Summary: The room was fairly clean. The breakfast was awful; very little choices & eggs tasted like water (not real). This is a smoke free hotel and yet there are cigarette butts all around the property.  When I checked in at 3 it smelled like smoke around my room. Went to a party and came back at 11pm and the smoke smell was horrible.  I told the front desk but these "kids" didn't seem to care. This is supposedly a smoke free hotel. My stomach is still upset from having to sleep with the wreaking smell in my lungs. I took pictures that I will share with the manager tomorrow. Yuck!  Here are some pictures right outside my room.

We traveled from El Paso, Texas to California before checking the prices on hotels first. There were several big events happening in the area the week of September 10th through 20th 2022 so prices were high. Thank God for Martin at Quality Inn. He was kind, knowledgeable and made us feel right at home. The room was clean, refreshing and very comfortable. Breakfast was superb. They even have staff prepare waffles during the week. We camped out two nights just to be able to come here again. Clean towels and cold air conditioning.. This time our room was in the back and again amazing. The best place to stay in California for sure. Safe, clean and welcoming!!!!
Room tip: Parking is spacious and safe. I would book through an app to save money. The Choice app is higher...

Summary: I was approached and questioned about my service dog when we were doing nothing but minding our own business, packing up our things in the parking lot atleast 40 feet from the hotel after what was seemingly a decent stay.  I then recieved rude comments when I stated one of the many tasks my service dog performs to get him out of our business and my personal space quickly. I told him it was pretty rude to ask when we are obviously going about our business and not causing any sort of disturbance. He then said "It looks like a pet, but I'll let it slide."  When I asked him who is manager was he turned his back on me and walked away with no response to my repeated questioning for his name and his managers name.  I called the front desk phone and he refused to give me his managers

You could not pay me to stay here again.  I urge you to look for another place to stay and avoid a horrible place that will rip you off. I took my family on a trip to see friends and figured for the price, that this would be a good place to stay.  Says breakfast will be included, however they "run out" of food and do zero to take care of issue. We saw drug use on the stairwell near elevator and management did nothing. BEWARE

Summary Heading: Good hotel but one member of the staff was terrible.
Summary: Nice hotel and good cleaning rooms. Comfortable bed and a decent breakfast service.  I only give them 3 stars because one of the employers call Ariel has this strange passive aggressive attitude with us. When we ask for a package he wasn’t polite at all so we ask for his name to make a complain and he say “Ariel and I’m also going to be here at the morning” like making us a warn, then he pass us the package and by the moment we receive it he just keep holding the box with this threatening attitude like waiting for so kind of reaction of us.
Manager Response: Hi Anfemo3, I thank you very much for staying with us recently and I apologize for any misunderstanding on our employees behalf, for any package pick up we do require a photo ID and the name on the package has to match the ID. I hope that you can give us another opportunity to make your stay great on your next trip to the area.

Summary: Very nice place to stay. Beds are wide and comfortable... place is clean and have all we needed travelling with two little boys. Had to mention the shower, since was suuuuuper good!!! Hot water and perfect pressure.
Manager Response: Hi Sandra,  We are pleased to hear that your stay was great and we met your expectations, we sure hope that you can visit us again soon.

Summary Heading: A great stay with a great price
Summary: Needed an affordable one night stay as a friend and I were visiting the CSU Fullerton campus which was only a 5 minute drive from the inn. At check-in, we were informed that our room was upgraded from a King to 2 queens which was perfect (at no additional cost). For COVID reasons they took our temperatures and had us sign paperwork in regards to their policies and procedures regarding the virus. In no time, we were in our rooms on the 2nd floor facing the parking lot. The room was spacious and very clean. The AC was tricky at first since we wanted to keep it running the whole stay but it turned off after a certain time. In the middle of the night it started warming up in the room and I was having troubles turning it back on...it wasn't a dealbreaker for me, but I could see
Manager Response: Dear JerryC362,  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your recent stay at our hotel.  We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel.  We are taking any precaution necessary to prevent the virus and yes we are taking temperatures at check in, have hand sanitizer stations on all floors and sanitizing all points of touch in the public areas as well as in the rooms.  We thank you for giving as an informational review and we hope to see you soon.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: This has become our favorite place to stay when going to Disneyland Resort! The staff has been absolutely amazing each time we've stayed. They have newly remodeled the rooms and they're beautiful. We'll definitely be going back as often as we can.
Room tip: The area the hotel is in is industrial so nights are incredibly quiet, no matter what floor we...
Manager Response: Hello Disneygurusmith,  We are very happy to hear that you have enjoyed your stay at our hotel. Our hotel strives to provide a clean and comfortable rooms for every single guest that visits us.  Thank you for your kind review and we hope to see you soon.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: I had a very good experience at my stay at this Quality Inn.  The facilities were in the process of being renovated, so it made for a nice and comfortable stay.  The wifi was good as well as the morning breakfast.  The only problem was the parking.  Not enough parking spaces for all the guests, so people made their own spaces along the sides of the lot.  The location was convenient along the 57 freeway and just north of the 91 freeway.  Though it seems to be a bit isolated, a short drive away are a lot of places to shop and eat.  Just a block away is a Sam's Club and a little over a mile is a Costco, so it's a great place to pick up supplies or gas up.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay at our hotel. We are very please to know that our hotel was of good value to you. Our hotel was undergoing renovations but we are all set and the parking issues are not a problem any more.  Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you soon.  Management,

Summary: Very efficient and friendly staff at check in. Room was not overly large but was satisfactory. Clean and comfortable. Breakfast had both hot and cold options. Fairly easy access to main roads with plenty of restaurants nearby.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay at our hotel. On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for acknowledging that our rooms were clean and comfortable.  We are also happy to hear that you enjoyed your breakfast the the customer service. We hope to see you again.  Management

Summary: My wife and I enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Simple but good. Breakfast is very good as well. Room is comfortable, simple and clean. Location is also pretty good. This is an affordable, simple hotel. Not great... I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel.  Glad that you found your room comfortable and that you felt that our breakfast was of good value to you. Thank you for your comment and we hope to see you soon again.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel many times before and I'm still hooked on the server, breakfast, and rooms. I booked a room with a king bed. While the is a bit smaller than other hotels that I have stayed at, it's just right for my stay in the North OC. Close to Cal State Fullerton, local businesses, freeways, and Disneyland. The service from the staff is still very friendly. The breakfast is among the better ones for it's class of hotels. Some of the breakfast items include waffles, scrambled eggs, potatoes, and cereals.   A tip for this hotel would be to get your breakfast before the rush of people, I try to be there within the first 90 minutes of service time.
Manager Response: Hello Mou2,  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay at our hotel. We are very exited to hear that your enjoy the value received at this our hotel and that you are like our service. Yes we are centrally located to many Southern California attractions including Disneyland, California Adventure, Universal Studios, and Knotts Berry Farm to name a few.  On behalf of our team we want to thank you for your review and we hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in November as a base for our Disney vacation. I booked based on ratings and price, and while it’s not as close to Disneyland as other hotels, I’m glad we stayed here. It was an easy 15 minute drive (we used Lyft mostly) and an even shorter one to the Honda Center where we went to a hockey game.  The hotel is tucked in a commercial and industrial area, and while it was a little strange, we didn’t find any issue with that at all. And yes, as other reviews say, it is an older building with some older decor, but that hardly affected our stay.  The room itself was very comfortable! The bed was comfortable, and everything was very clean. Cleanliness, especially in the bathroom, is the most important factor for me. Housekeeping should
Manager Response: Hello Kara,  We would like to thank you for a very informative review on our Hotel.  We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that our hotel was clean and comfortable for your vacation needs.  Our hotel is in the process of a soft renovation and we will be changing the noisy ac units.  Thank you for your time to tell us about your stay and we hope that you stay with us soon.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: We really enjoyed it, it was so much cheaper than right out side disney but driving to disney was easy. The breakfast was good and filling and the room itself was nice and clean. I will point out that there was a lot of smokers, it didn't bother us but it definitely might deter other non smokers.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at our hotel.  We take pride in providing clean comfortable rooms and great customer service.  Our hotel also provides a buffet style breakfast for all our guests and we are glad that you enjoyed it.  We are a non smoking property and guests are allowed to smoke outside in designated areas or 8 feet away from the building.  Never the less if smoke bothers our guest we will address the issue.  Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you soon.  Sincerely, Management

Summary Heading: Quality is not the true description
Summary: Lets start by saying this place has all the charm and cozy ambiance of a minimum security federal prison.  It starts with a sign at the door advising if you or somebody you know is being forced to work in a job against their will, to call the number provided.  I have never seen such a sign at any other hotel or motel ever.  This motel is in an industrial area and makes you wonder who their clients are.  The reception area is spartan and reminiscent of a very low level government office.  The tile floor is in serious need of cleaning.  The grout, which was once a light color, is now seriously dark brown.  The tile in the elevator is gross with gunk piled up all around the edges. Summary: I’ve grown to really love the level of service, accommodation and comfort you get from a Quality Inn. This one was no exception. A perfect location for Disney, the Angels baseball and also shopping at Orange Outlet. We’ll definitely look at Quality Inns first in future.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your recent stay at our hotel.  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the level of service of our team at the Quality Inn Placentia.   We are definitely centrally located to most of the attractions in Southern California and our team takes pride in delivering a higher level of service.  We hope to see you soon.  Sincerely, Management

Summary Heading: Basic but might be ok for a short stay...
Summary: Stayed at this Inn for 8 nights, probably too long for this place.    First, continental breakfast. Enough food to get your day started; egg patty(?), sausage patty, make your own waffles, cereal, toast, oatmeal and a few other things I can’t remember. However, breakfast during the week was only served until 9am(10am weekends). Great if you’re a business traveler but we found it ended too early for leisure travelers like ourselves.   Plenty free parking. Neighborhood was quiet and industrial. Felt pretty safe. 7-11 close by.   The room. Tiny. Difficult for two people with two suitcases to find space, ended up using the chair from the desk as an end table. Some mold on the bathroom walls, no fan so not much ventilation in there.  Small pest problem. Little flies were coming out
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  On behalf of our entire team I would like to apologize for a less than pleasant stay at our hotel.  We have shared your review with our team and will be working towards making our guests stays more comfortable.  We will discuss having the breakfast open later than 9 am on weekdays and will also mention the pest issue to our pest control company.  It is our hope that you give us another opportunity to serve you better.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: We stayed in this motel for 5 nights. One of the nights we had very loud neighbors all night and the staff were not helpful enough despite 2 calls to the front desk. We also stayed in 2 different rooms. One was great and the other could have smelled much better. The staff were mixed. Female staff were great, male not so much. The breakfast was just so so- could have been much better. We liked the location and neighborhood. Liked the beds and bed linens. Nice pool with ducks in it while we were there. The neighborhood is mostly industrial.

Me and my mom stayed here for four nights for our Disney trip! Everything was clean and very nice! The beds were comfy. Had a good breakfast and always had cookies at night! Definitely would recommend this place!
Manager Response: Hello Nicolelynette,   On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your review.  Your feedback is very important to us and we can assure you that we will use this information to do everything possible to create an enjoyable experience for each of our guests.   We are happy to hear that you enjoy the rooms and the facilities at our hotel.  We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Management,

Summary: We are a group of families with kids to Fullerton for science tournament. We had to leave early the next morning for the event. Breakfast on regular weekend starts from 7pm, which was too late for us. Ms. Florencia of Quality Inn Placentia was very nice to prepare the breakfast earlier for us, and offered her help to see whether we needed anything. We really appreciate her kindness and warm words. Big thanks!
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your recent stay at our hotel.   We very much appreciate and value your feedback and will share it with our team and Florencia.  Your survey responses will serve as encouragement to all of our staff as we strive to continuously improve the quality of our services to provide an exceptional experience for our guests.  It is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback.  Thank you again for sharing your experience, and we hope your next visit will be even more pleasant than the previous one.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: We were very pleased with Quality Inn Placentia. Good location, close to everything. The management was courteous, the room was clean and decidedly comfortable. The breakfast was better than most, although our only complaint was that the eating accommodations were a bit cramped. But we would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Hello Sonova_Beach,  We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel. On behalf of our entire staff we want to thank you for your positive review, we love to hear that our guests are enjoying our clean and comfortable rooms and our great customer service.  Thank you for letting us know that the breakfast was better than most.  Again thank you for your review and we hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: No hot tube. Room was decent and clean. Would have liked more towels. Breakfast was average and same thing daily. After being there 3 nights I wanted something different. Quiet place but a little bit away from places to eat.

Summary Heading: I stay here every other month for work!
Summary: Every time I have to come into Fullerton for work, as a Choice Diamond Member I always stay with Choice, and this is the best Choice Hotel in the Anaheim area! They always have a water waiting for me at the desk, and there's plenty to UberEats or Postmates from, and it's 3 miles from my LA office. The staff is always friendly, and I'm happy to call myself a regular guest at this hotel! Plus free cookies on check in! Like a Double Tree for half the cost! Everyone knows you only stay at a Double Tree because of the free cookies... Haha

Summary Heading: Great value excellent service from front desk
Summary: Much better option than the high priced options near Disneyland. The rooms are well equipped with refrigerator, microwave, work desk with a good quality chair, many electrical outlets, new type shower head with good water pressure and good quality mattress on the bed. Breakfast had several hot food options and a big variety. Front desk staff went out of their way to accommodate my needs and made my stay perfect. Parking is free so overall a great value and highly recommended.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  On behalf of our entire staff I would like to thank you for your review.  We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel and that you felt that our hotel was of great value to you.  Our team strives to deliver clean and comfortable rooms every day and we are glad that you enjoyed your room. Your review will help us as encouragement to our team. Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: Off putting, Bad smell in the air, also the bedding seems damp. It smells like mold or something they tried to cover up with some sort of air freshener. I will not be back. The room is nice though ....
Manager Response: Hello Brian,  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your recent stay at our hotel.  We are very disappointed to hear that your stay was not up to standard.  On behalf our entire staff please accept our sincere apology, we have shared your review with our cleaning staff and the room has been inspected to make sure that there is no smell in the future.  Again, thank you for your review and we hope that you give us another opportunity to serve you better.  Sincerely, Management

Summary Heading: Nice little Inn for a quick stay
Summary: We stayed here in the beginning of July to see some friends in the area. For the price it was the cheapest in the area. Also, we had the mindset of we were staying at a Quality Inn and not a fancy hotel. But some good things we did like.  Pro's -Lot's of parking. Parking is free and you don't have to pay extra -There is continental breakfast. Nothing special but a good variety of warm foods such as sausage and bacon. Fruits & Coffee. -They do have a baby crib upon request. They came in a timely manner. -Staff was really friendly. -It's on a industrial road, but if you go down a little further about 5 minutes away, they're a lot of places to eat. Your typical fast food chains and restaurants, so that was a plus if you have a family. - It does have a onsite laundry mat  Con's - We

The first thing I look at when I enter a room is the carpet. The room I was in at the back had a newer carpet. It had a refrigerator. There was a laundry room so that was nice, something I always need being a light traveler. They also sell laundry detergent. The breakfast spread had the typical dishes (cornflakes, scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles, fruits, bread, toaster, coffee, etc). Fullerton Marriott on Nutwood has a good breakfast. It was in a convenient and quiet location. There are shopping areas with restaurants, cafes, etc close by, the best being Fullerton downtown (15 minute drive at the corner of Chapman & Harbor) and the shopping complex at the corner of State College & Chapman (7 minute drive). If you are into coffee then try Philz Coffee at the corner of State

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you are going to Disney
Summary: We were a group of 10 with 4 rooms. Stayed 2 nights mid-June 2018. We were happy about the free parking, breakfast, wifi but no time to use the pool. The hotel was quite full as we stayed on a Friday and Saturday. The only thing negative to say is about the breakfast. The poor lady who was working at the buffet was swamped. Was very hard for her to keep up with the demand. We thanked her once the “rush” was over both days.  Not sure if it’s always like that but she deserves a gold medal. Unfortunately cannot remember her name but think that she is Filipino. Please commendate her.

My family stayed here last week and we had no problems.  I chose this hotel because of the low price. The beds and pillows were super soft, the room was clean and the shower had excellent water pressure. Breakfast and parking are free and the staff are very friendly. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good value and  location for our purpose
Summary: It was pretty much typical Quality Inn. Nice room, comfy bed, great hot breakfast. The pool is adequate--nothing fancy. Stayed 2 nights, no problems. It has easy freeway access and plenty of off street parking. I like the outside entrance where one can back the car right up to the room.

Summary Heading: The staff is very accommodating and its clean
Summary: Alexis i believe is her name goes above and beyond there place is clean and they take pride she also had the pool cleaned caise leaves had went in cause of the wind the breakfast was also good ...thanks all see u soon definitely agood spot
Manager Response: Dear Steven,  Thank you for taking the time and letting me know about your recent stay at our hotel.  We appreciate your comments and they will serve as encouragement to our team to keep delivering great service and clean and comfortable rooms.  We will definitely make sure that Alexis knows that she went above and beyond her duty to provide exceptional service.  Again thank you for your review and hope to see you soon.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: Overall it is an ok hotel, but the price was decent, there was free parking & wifi, & included breakfast.  Our room was a decent size but smelled a bit musty. There was a mini fridge & microwave as well. The bed was too firm for my taste.  The bathroom could be improved. The water pressure from the sink was very low & the shower faucet had a slow leak. Plus only 2 full size towels were stocked. It would be nice to have 3.  The breakfast was mediocre. There was a do it yourself waffle maker though. That looked good but the bagels, muffins, & other hot food looked unappealing. I had oatmeal- it was plain packet oatmeal.  Overall if you just want somewhere to sleep while you do tourist stuff the rest of the time this may be a budget friendly place for you.
Manager Response: Hello Livi422,  On behalf of our entire staff I would like to apologize for a less than pleasant stay at our hotel.  I have shared your review with our preventive maintenance team and housekeeping to make sure that we are delivering a clean and comfortable stay. We will be reviewing our breakfast selection to make sure that our offerings for the complimentary continental breakfast are well liked by all our guests.  Thank you again for your comments and we hope that you give us another opportunity to serve you better.  Sincerely, Management

Summary Heading: Nice hotel at a good price
Summary: It was a nice comfortable and clean hotel. The pool was decent but did lack a hot tub which I do enjoy. The breakfast was good, and parking was easy. The wifi was good and they have self serve laundry which came in handy.
Manager Response: Hello Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at our hotel.  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our amenities and that you felt that our breakfast was of good value to you.  We are sorry about the absence of a hot tub, it will be a request that we will send to upper management for our future renovation.    It is a pleasure to hear a positive comment and we hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Very reasonable and a great location for Disney and other attractions
Summary: Very nice, and clean hotel, even though its an older hotel. It offers a decent hot breakfast, with eggs, bacon and of course waffles.  Very convenient to disney and other attractions. It w as too cold to swim, but the pool looked great.The staff was friendly and we Would definitely stay here again

This property is tucked away off the freeway surround by an industrial area but don't let that turn you away. I had a room on the 3rd floor and it was quiet like a fish! The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable! They offered a really decent selection of breakfast foods in the morning. The front desk people were very courteous and check in was quick! The only negative is the unusual design of the building because you have to go outside for the elevator! (The last few mornings have been quite chilly!!) When I'm back in the area, I'm staying here again!

Well where do begin. I asked the travel agent I want a quiet hotel, reasonable prices, easy to access and with free parking and boy did he deliver.  Now if your looking for a luxurious 5 star establishment this isn’t the one for you however if your on a budget like things simple then this is ideal long as you have a rental car.  Based in anaheim is does seem like your an hour from everywhere except Disney land that’s 15mins down the road.  The hotel itself is basic bed and bathroom room decor a little dated but was very clean and cleaned daily staff were all excellent the bed was big tho I found it was slightly soft for my liking as I prefer a mattress that resembles concrete. At 2.5 star I think is about right possible a 3. Hotel is in more of an industrial area but good links

Elderly mother-in-law lives in Placentia so we must visit often.  This place fits the bill...nice staff, decent rooms, good breakfast.  The carpet, drapes and bedspread don't match but everything was very clean and worked well.

We had 2 rooms, both clean, quiet, convenient. Plenty to do in the area. One room AC was kind of loud, Plenty of parking, but I did notice many people parking and then walking down the street, like they were going to work or school. Never did check out the free breakfast, we hit the Starbucks down the street. Easy in & out to the freeway and area attractions. Disney is about 15 minutes away

We were disappointed that the pool was not available, and the tv was weird when we changed channels. But the breakfast had many options and was well managed by attentive staff.  It was quiet enough, clean, convenient and comfortable.

Needed a quick place to stay for a quick trip to Disney. Stayed 2 nights. About 12 minutes from disneylands parking lot and easy parking. Quiet area. Not any restaurants nearby and the closest Starbucks is about a mile away. The breakfast in the morning is nothing fancy but you can't beat the price...free. Coffee. Tea, juice. Bagels. Generic egg rounds. Sausage. Biscuits. Gravy. Muffins. Cereal. You get the idea. Great for a quick belly full and off to Disney. And waffles. I forgot about the waffles. Pretty typical for this type of hotel. Very safe. Very quiet. Did not go to the fitness area or pool. Breakfast starts at 6 M-F and 7 on the weekends. Room was clean. A/C was a little noisy but not bad. Our room had a microwave and mini fridge. Bathroom was small but the water was

Fabulous Hotel ~ Fantastic stay! Extended stay ~Nov. to Dec./17 All the bells & whistles included.  Clean rooms & carpets. Lovely comfy beds, great linen & nice, soft towels. Great Free Wifi, Parking, Breakfast, Ice ~ Washer/Dryer, vending machines onsite.  In-room heater/AC. Room keys work well! Friendly, accommodating staff & housekeeping. 5 Star stay, at a Great price. O My!  We drove to Disneyland this trip, rather than fly, so can stay away from the hustle & bustle of Downtown Disney ~ So glad that we did. 10-15 mins. to Disneyland, can avoid freeways to get there, too!  It's November & pool is open, too  :)  No complaints ~ Would recommend to Everyone! Thanks for having us! Truly, Donna Lee

Finding decent combinations within 20 minutes of Disneyland for under $100 can be a challenge. By no means is this place fancy it's very basic and it's in a Industrial Park type neighborhood. But the staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean, the free breakfast is solid and the price is absolutely right.

Had a younger lady give me such attitude about checking in, when I had called prior to booking the hotel to insure I would be able to check in early due to a last min travel for a meeting for work. When I arrived the employee gave me a run around for excuses, and couldn't even give a straight answer. There was another employee behind her telling her to check me in, however the employee stated "no." Then the employee told me not to come in to her hotel with an attitude, when to my knowledge she was not the manager, as I had asked for one and "there was not going to be a manager on duty until the following day." By far one of the worst experiences I have ever had at a quality inn, maybe they need to hire more experienced, even tempered employees that have schooling.

Summary Heading: Reasonably priced for quality and location
Summary: During our trip to Disneyland, my family of 4 stayed at this hotel for two nights. The room was clean and quiet. Our only complaints are the size of the beds and the shower. The beds were full size instead of queen but that was probably my fault for not reading the room description thoroughly. The shower made a high pitched squeaky sound. So ear-piercing that we all got in and out of the shower as quickly as possible. That was in room 230. Overall, this hotel is decent and reasonably priced.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your review about your recent stay at our hotel.  We appreciate your comments about the cleanliness of the hotel.  Our staff strives to always provide clean and comfortable rooms.   We will be sharing your review with our staff and again thank you for taking the time to write a review on our hotel.  It is our hope that you choose our hotel for your future stays.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: Stayed for four nights. To my surprise it was very clean and was cleaned every day. However the last day the cleaning lady had I guess forgotten to hang up the shower curtain again since it was folded and was laying on top of our towels. We had to hang up the curtain ourselves... didn't feel very fresh with finding it was laying on the towels. Anyway, we only ate the breakfast our first day. It was just ok.

Booked through choicehotels which we do often.  This was sadder and older than most, but we got the king bed, ground floor that we requested.  Room was small, but had a refrigerator; bed was comfy.  Round egg somethings and good sausage for breakfast ... loud tv in the small breakfast room made us choose the lobby for eating.  No one at the desk at check-out ... just not classy.

Stay here because of cost and proximity to my son's college.  Rooms were clean and comfortable and you get a decent breakfast.  Stayed on third floor which has an interior hallway vs floors 1 and 2 with exterior access.  Not too many amenities nearby. It may be a "non smoking" hotel yet the smell of the ashtray/trash can outside the door to the interior hall entered the hallway and I had the room right by the door and could smell the ashtray.

Sad end to our otherwise wonderful honeymoon in the US! Called QI to let them know we'd be a day late and they couldn't find our booking after 20 mins on the phone despite us having all the relevant reference numbers etc, was told he'd thought he'd found it and would 'make a note'. When we arrived they had cancelled our booking despite my call. We then had to pay again as apparently they'd refunded the booking company already (leaving us to now try to sort out a refund with our booking company).  Our second night we got about an hours slept total due to the very loud gathering in the room next door, which seemed to involve prostitution. Reported to reception on our check-out the next morning and not even an eyebrow was raised, no apology just 'I'll let them (the upper
Manager Response: Hello Red S,  I would like to apologize for a less than pleasant stay at our hotel.  Thank you for taking the time to let us know the experience of your reservation.  We recommend our guests to book directly with our hotel since there are guidelines that we need to follow with third party reservation channels.  Our ability to adjust a reservation that was not paid directly to our hotel is limited when you do not show up for your reservation since the third party company requires a refund for the rest of your stay.    We are very sorry that you had to experience loud neighbors.  Our guest services agents are well trained to take care of this type of disturbance with professionalism.  Sorry we did not hear about the noise inconvenience until the day of your check out.    Please accept our sincere apology and we hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you better.  Sincerely, Guest Services Manager.

Summary: Hotel that is close to all the amusement parks. Food options are pretty slim nearby since it is in an industrial park neighborhood. Breakfast was ok, not nearly as other hotels complimentary breakfast. There needs to be more towels in the room. Beds were very comfortable. Room was pretty small, but bathroom was big. Service staff was very friendly which helped with the rating.

Was expecting something very different.  Reviews said it was very highly rated so I took a chance.  It did not meet my expectations.  From the splatter stains on the sheers to the mismatching carpet, drapes, walls, etc...it was more than tired.  I was really surprised at how this was reviewed and what I found.  Would not stay there.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel in a Quiet Neighborhood
Summary: Friendly staff at Front Desk, One elevator by the entrance for handicapped guest. Plenty of parking space (though 2 big busses were parked when I was staying severely limiting parking). Average breakfast. Rooms came with microwave and a small fridge which was really convenient.

I really like this place! Great staff!!! Great rooms. Great location. Just 15-20 minutes from the areas main attractions.  The rooms have very comfortable beds and all rooms come with a microwave and a mini fridge. Very convenient! Breakfast offers many protein options. They offer a nice variety and fresh fruit and juices.  The pool is small but adequate and kept clean. Sitting out at the pool can be quite relaxing. My friend was out there every day.  There is a small laundry room and workout room. The property is on a fairly quiet street/culdesac depending on what time of day. It's well groomed and the interior is kept up as well.  I highly recommend this place!

Close to CA-57 freeway, but quiet and well priced.  Plenty of parking.  Top floor (3rd) has interior room entry, bottom two floors have external room entry.  Room was clean and ready at 3:00 pm arrival.  Good selection of TV channels.  Food choices are limited in immediate area, but better selection within 5 minutes.  A good choice for basic accommodations.

Summary Heading: Whatever the room was cleaned with was awful..good parking, good bed
Summary: The positive this hotel offered good parking, a decent size clean room with a king bed and breakfast.   But the deal breaker was the  sickening smelling cleaner that was absolutely awful. I can't even describe how bad it was and we only got some relief by using the AC.  The other thing is the hard sell of the promotions department trying to sell us package by claiming we had won a $150 Visa gift card then wanting a $150 deposit for another hotel room.   I enter legit contests and that is simply a scam. Coupled with the terrible smell, it totally turned us off staying at Quality Inns in the future.

We checked in without a problem, but when we got to the room it was still being cleaned. We where asked to wait in the hallway for a few minutes. No big deal I'm patient, but then again the next day we came back around 3 to find the room hand not been serviced. We got a nock on our door around 4pm asking if we'd like to have the room cleaned, by then I had 3 tired kids ready for a nap so I had to decline Oh well.  Complimentary breakfast was decent, kids enjoyed their fresh made waffles and sausage/egg biscuit sandwiches.   Overall I'd probably stay again, its decent for the price. I was great to have a washer dryer available as well.

This place was great !! Clean, quiet and safe. The staff was politeful and helpful.And the price was below what surrounding hotels were charging. We highly recommend this location and will stay here when we return to this hotel when we visit Orange County.

We checked in hotel around 10pm and had no problems whatsoever. The front desk clerk was very friendly and helpful. The room was pretty spacious and had an excellent WIFI connection for free. The best part of our 2 night stay was the breakfast. Huge assortment of breakfast items and was constantly being restocked by a friendly, little lady. Great location if you need a reasonably priced room close to Disneyland.

Stayed here for 2 nights while visiting disneyland. They hotel is a easy 5 mile drive to disneyland and the hotel its self was pretty nice. In a good location and the price was good. They provided a excellent free breakfast and the rooms were nice and clean. Very satisfied in this hotel.

🔹Front desk was pleasant and accommodating. She helped us by changing the type of room so we can be on the ground floor with our service dog. They also helped us with a late checkout.   🔹Room was clean and bed was super comfortable.   🔹The ac unit needs work as it was really loud.   🔹Bathroom might need a little deep cleaning.   I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice Room, Clean, Quiet, Friendly Staff, Great Breakfast!
Summary: We needed a room that was close to Disneyland. Quality Inn Placentia-Anaheim is about 15 minutes by car from Disneyland (6 -7 miles) and fit the bill. The room was clean & quiet! The staff was friendly - Flo (the breakfast lady) was a real hoot - loved her! The breakfast was hot (eggs, sausage, waffles, bagels, muffins, bread, cereal, fruit, orange juice, apple juice, & cranberry juice). The beds were great & the shower hot! The hotel is located on a dead end street near businesses & family homes, close to freeways and has both stairs & an elevator to access rooms. Our only problem was upon returning about 11am in the evening on our 2nd night there we had to park in a business close by and walk to our room because there was a fatal accident on the road almost in front of the

My husband and I decided to stay somewhere near Disneyland for a night, after we went to Knott's Berry Farm after his work one day. This hotel was a good location for both. The room was decent (we weren't expecting much, but thought it was pleasant enough).  At 3:30 am though, I was awoken by the voices of the room next door. I don't think they were talking overly loud, but they could clearly be heard. Shortly after, somebody knocked on our door, and quickly went away (I'm guessing somebody in a drunken stupor knocked nad realized quickly that they had gone to the wrong room). As the doors are all facing outward, I think it's very easy for anybody to come and disturb. The talking next door continued on until 5:30 am. While I thought about calling the front desk to ask them to

This is the best place to stay if you are traveling to Orange County. We booked several rooms for our reunion and everyone said the same thing, it was great. The breakfast is wonderful, the rooms were nice and clean. The maid service was great. Everyone on staff was so helpful, even when I needed a safety pin. When I come back to CA this is where I will be staying, This trip made my second visit, Thank you Quality Inn.

On the plus side, the beds were comfy, and we had a room for handicap that was comfortable for my husband to get around in his walker. Also there was plenty of parking for our SUV with trailer. On the negative side, the blankets were too thin - no comforters like we ususlly find at hotels. Also, we always enjoy a breakfast before we start out on the road in the morning, but there was a tour group that took up all available space.

We needed a reasonable priced hotel for a couple of nights at a conference in Placentia. Most hotels nearby were quite pricey and the Quality Inn was under a $100 per night, with breakfast, free wifi and close to freeways, but not too close.

From the moment we got to the front desk we were made to feel welcome.  The room and bed were both spotless and comfortable.  I did have a small problem with the chair in the room but the staff sorted it out in short order :)  Breakfast was basic but there were plenty of choices and as it was a buffet style you could eat all you wanted.  All in all I can heartily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting LA for Universal or Disney as it's close by but without the outrageous prices.

Manager Roberto  was the rudest hotel manager.  .Just warning if you have a problem with your room, oh well Roberto won't even help you out.   WILL NEVER GO BACK!!!!   Don't waste your money, wish I would have done more research before booking this Hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Stephanie Dwelle,  Please allow me to apologize if I seemed rude over the phone.  Please know that your reservations booked by your travel agent were sent to us only for two rooms with one king size bed only for double occupancy.  During our conversation I explained to you that my front desk agents were able to accommodate your request for two beds in one room and another room with a king bed and a sofa sleeper.  These upgrades do require an upgrade fee but I waived it to accommodate your stay.  I was just simply not allowing more discounts to you because we did accommodate your needs and my team did everything possible to give you the beds you needed.  I am sorry if I seem rude when I said there would not be an additional discount.  I hope that you understand that our hotel staff tried our best to accommodate you and your family.  Thank you for your review.  Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary: Stayed for 2 nights with kids. Clean rooms, have microwave and refrigerator im rooms. Pool is heated and clean, no hot tub. Breakfast is good selection and therebwas a very happy and friendly keeping everything full! We ubered to Disney, 10 minute ride and about $10 fare.

This is a slightly out of the way motel although it did a fine job looking after 80 young people and their coaches on this trip. Staff was, of course, quite busy but they carried out their business with a smile and were quite helpful. The rooms were mid size with a comfortable enough bed and a fridge and microwave. The bathroom is a little small but was kept clean. The included breakfast had the usual continental ingredients plus the waffle maker and sausages. Disneyland was a 10 minute drive away and shopping opportunities a little closer. This stay was generally a good experience.
Manager Response: Hello John M,  Thank you so much for your review of our hotel the Quality Inn Placentia.  We are happy to hear that you were satisfied with our service.  I am specially glad that our staff were able to carry business with a smile and that they did a great job with providing clean and comfortable rooms.  Our hotel does have an extended breakfast with waffles, sausage patties and egg patties and of course we have the plenty of more items for a full continental breakfast.  I will be sharing your review with our staff so they know that they are doing a great job and that our guest are having a good experience at our hotel. Again thank you for your review and we hope to see you again soon.  Best Regards, Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a trip to CA. On the first night, founds stains (might have been wine?) all over the comforter. I called down to the desk and was advised I could be switched to another room. I asked to see the room first and upon inspection found that the comforter in the new room was also dirty. That said, the stains were more concerning than what I think was wine on the first room. I ended up staying in the first room and did receive a clean comforter the following day. Otherwise, room is pretty much what you would expect for the price. Treadmill in the "gym" (converted motel room) was broken. Hallway smelled of marijuana the first night. The best part of this place is that it's relatively close to Disney and right next to this awesome little place
Manager Response: Hello kalaughlin,  I want to thank you for taking the time and review our hotel.  I would like to apologize for giving you a room that was not up to standard your review has been shared with our housekeeping staff to prevent this from happening in the future.  Thank you for bringing up to our attention the elevator permit, the department of industrial relations has been notified since 5 months ago and we are schedule for an inspections soon. I am glad that you found us convenience for Disneyland and the Bruery, two places that you definitely do not want to miss when visiting this area.    Thank you again for your review and we hope that you consider us for your future stays.  Best Regards, Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary: Other than the fact that they didn't fulfill my request for a ground floor room and there was no sofa as had been depicted when I booked, there was really nothing 'wrong' with our accommodations.  Luckily they had an elevator.  The room was small, but we merely slept there after checking in and going to a dinner show.  The bed was comfortable, the room clean and overall maintenance was somewhat above average.  While the standard fare for Choice properties, the breakfast and dining area were both above average.  The lady taking care of replenishing the food, although by herself (and the place was packed when we were there), did an excellent job.  Check in and out were a breeze as we are Choice Privileges members and were using points for a free night.
Manager Response: Hello Ron P,  First of all I would like to thank you for taking the time and letting us know about your recent stay at our hotel.  I am glad that you enjoyed the breakfast and the service provided, even when the hotel was completely full and most guests were enjoying breakfast.  I will make sure to pass on your compliment to our break fast attendant.   I would like to apologize for not meeting your request for a first floor room, I will make sure that we do everything possible for our future guests to meet their requests.  I would also like to say thank you for being a Choice Privileges member and happy to hear that my team recognized your loyalty to our brand.  Thank you for choosing our brand and we hope to see you soon.  Best Regards, Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary Heading: Decent hotel, close to a great brewery
Summary: Booked via Choice with Points.  The check in was OK, the room was cleanif a bit dated, with cheaper furniture, not to Fairfield Inn level (but it is now a Quality Inn). King bed which was a bit lumpy, lumpy pillows, decent TV, microwave and fridge, free wifi.   Plenty of parking, decent pool, little gym with old equipment, OK breakfast. In walking distance to the Bruery.  Overall, OK if at the right price.
Manager Response: Hello Lubiere,  I want to thank you for being a Choice Privileges member and thank you for your review.  Please accept my sincere apology if the hotel was of less value than what you expected.  We do offer complimentary breakfast, complimentary parking and wifi.  We are close to the Bruery and to Disneyland and centrally located for other Southern California attractions.    I hope that you found our hotel of good value for the price paid and it is our desire that you choose our hotel for your future stays.  Sincerely, Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for one night while attending commencement at CSUF..  It's reasonably clean and in good condition for the price.  Location is in an industrial area but pretty quiet since it was a Saturday night.  The staff was ok.  Check-in was impersonal.  The highlight on the staff was a elderly woman (I think Filipino) who was quite delightful.   Breakfast was average to fair, they were running out of the sausage constantly.
Manager Response: Dear RedwoodShores305,  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your recent stay at our hotel.  I am glad to hear that you found our hotel adequate for your visit and your needs.  We are very close to CSUF, thank you for letting us know that the hotel was quiet even on a Saturday night when we are typically sold out.  I will make sure to share your comment with my staff so we improve out service when our guests are checking in.  I will let our breakfast attendant know about your positive comment about her and we will make sure that food is promptly replenish.    Again thank you for your comment and we hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely, Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary: Clean but small room. Fridge and microwave are a nice touch. Breakfast just ok - crowded and not much fresh stuff. Location was good for my meetings but I wouldn't want to spend much time in the room other than sleeping.
Manager Response: Dear Magique1960,  I would like to thank you for taking the time to review our hotel the Quality Inn Placentia.  I am glad to hear that the hotel was close to your meeting and that you enjoyed our amenities.  Our rooms are equiped with a microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, hair dryer and an iron with an ironing board for your convenience.  I apologize if the room was smaller than your expectations.  I will make sure to talk to upper management about including more fresh options for breakfast.    Again thank you for your review and it is our hope that you consider our hotel for your next visit to the area.   Sincerely, Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary: Free WIFI, free parking, free breakfast. We were there for a family vacation and the hotel is about 15 minutes from Disneyland. The rooms were small but sufficient. The bed and linenes were clean and comfortable. Our room had a strong unidentified smell, if we hadn't been so tired upon check in we would have asked for a different room. We propped the door open for a while. There was a fridge, microwave and the room seemed recently updated. There was black mold in the bathtub. If not for the mold and funky smelling room I'd have rated this 4 stars, as I was otherwise impressed. Good job Quality Inn, I may stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and will consider staying with us again. Please do let us know if there is anything else we can do to improve, we apologize for the issues you faced. Thank you for candid comments and your business.

Summary: This is my second time staying at the Quailty Inn in Placentia and will be my last. Their rudeness is a turnoff. No greeting no thank you or any appreciation for your business.... I their is a lack of training in customer service or a basic understanding of the hospitality business...   The meaning of Hospitality...   noun 1. the friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests, visitors, or strangers.  It's very simple...
Manager Response: Hello Guest,  We do sincerely apologize for the service you had received. Please do allow us to serve you again and we will rectify these issues. Thank you for your candid comments and your business.

Summary: This hotel serves it's purpose especially if you're just look for a place to sleep. The room wasn't big at all and it was also outdated. The bed was comfortable though and the staff was nice and welcoming. Breakfast was included which was nice as well.   Definitely a good place if you're looking to save a dollar and just want somewhere to sleep.
Manager Response: Hello Guest,  We are glad to hear that you found your stay satisfactory. Please do come again soon. Please if you have any other suggestions, let us know and we will try our best to incorporate them. Thank you for your comments and business.

Summary: Our 2 day stay was A1 +.  If any one writes a bad review about this motel, the are sabotaging to review process.  This place is in our top 10 and we stayed at more than 100 motels the past 3 years. ENJOY THE AREA

Not the worse I've stayed, clearly not the best either. Carpet is very dated. The front desk when I checked in late was not very friendly. I guess that's the thanks for being a diamond member. If I wasn't using points would I pay for this one, no. I'd have spent just a little bit more for a little bit better hotel

I agree with other reviewers,  this is a motel and rooms are tiny but the price was great and since we were just sleeping there,  it was fine.  Comfortable beds,  a/c worked great.  If your planning to stay multiple nights,  this may not be the best  choice. But if you just need a bed,  it's just fine.

I stayed for 2 nights at this place, which definitely feels like a budget motel.  To be fair, the price is quite reasonable.  My room was small, and the bathroom door clunked loudly against the counter every time it was left open.  The bathroom area was cramped.  There was a fridge and microwave, but they took up a lot of room in an already small space.  The walls were thin and other guests were loud until quite late.  The place feels quite dated and a bit shabby.  But generally functional, easy to find, good service, and reasonably priced.
Manager Response: Meh,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at our hotel.  Your feedback is greatly appreciated and we are glad that you found the room to be of good value and reasonably priced.  We apologize that the room was not of your liking and are glad that you found value in our service.  If you are ever not completely satisfied with your room please feel free to contact our front desk agent so we can accommodate you in a room that is functional for you.   Again we thank you for your review and we hope that you give us another opportunity to serve you better.  Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary Heading: Deceptive! This should be called a "Motel", not "Hotel".
Summary: Tiny room crammed with cheap looking furnishing. Sagging beds. Odorous, moldy smelling room, dirty carpet. People's smoke outside the balcony would seep into your "non-smoking", so if you're intolerant of smoke smell, don't stay here.  Place has a funky smell overall.  Wouldn't recommend at all.
Manager Response: Greatlife99, I would like to sincerely apologized for a less than pleasant stay at our hotel.  On behalf of our entire team please accept our apology for not providing you with the accommodations, facility and service that you deserve.   It is our hope that you five us another opportunity to better serve you in the future.  Sincerely, Roberto Vasquez

Summary Heading: Dirty hotel room. Rude, nasty, unprofessional manager.
Summary: Upon checking in and unpacking after a long day, we were getting ready for bed around 10 PM.  We found out the bed linens were not changed from the previous guest check out, had many hairs on sheets (head hairs, body hairs, pubic hairs).  I called front desk and was told there was no other staff at the hotel to bring new sheets and change them.  Hotel sold out with a high school softball team so no feasibly available room for us to switch to. We didn't mind to go down to front desk to pickup the new bed linens to change the sheets ourselves.  Upon taking down the bed sheets, we were horrified to see how dirty the blanket was! We brought it to the front desk to exchange for a new one and also to pick up new sheets one more time, as the new sheets given to us the first time was of
Manager Response: LovetoTravelSage,  On behalf of our entire team at the Quality Inn Placentia I would like to sincerely apologize for your recent stay at our hotel.  I am very concerned about the level of service that you received at our hotel, our team is always ready to accommodate our guests in every possible way.  I have noted all the deficiencies that you mentioned in your review and will make sure that none of our guests experience a less than pleasant stay.  While looking at the notes on your reservation we noticed that you were fully compensated and another room was offered to you, again I am sorry that we were not able to provide you the level of service that you deserve.   Sincerely, Roberto Vasquez

Summary Heading: Great Pros, Terrible Cons = Extremely Alright
Summary: Quick checklist: PROS - Clean Room - Comfortable Beds - Microwave, mini-fridge, and television in-room - plenty of hot water for showers - Simple but effective breakfast  CONS - leaky faucet from outside soaked through into our carpet - some guest issues (loud outside after midnight & minor pot use)  Booked this room through Hotwire for a three-night stay, after having just had a terrible experience booking through them previously and getting a rat-hole of a hotel. Luckily, this one was initially great, as we had come in to find a room furnished with a comfortable bed, clean sheets, neat and tidy room, refrigerator, and microwave.  We got the room because of a competitive rate near Disneyland, which was the focus of our trip, as we were using the final days of our premium Annual
Manager Response: Rafael M,  Please accept my sincere apology for failing exceed your expectations.  I am very sorry for the inconvenience that you experienced with the wet carpet, this was an issue that we did not have an explanation about.  We are glad that our amenities worked out for you and that the room overall was comfortable except for the incident.  Please know that our team is always ready to take care of noise issues in a very gentle way.  I am glad that you enjoyed the breakfast.    Please feel free to contact me for any of your future hotel needs and I will personally make sure that your room is comfortable.    Sincerely, Roberto Vasquez

Summary: This was my first trip driving solo to the LA area! My sister and I traveled to Anaheim to see a baseball game. I wanted a Choice Motel as close to Angel Stadium as possible. This location was perfect. Easy travel to the stadium and back.
Manager Response: Lorane, Thank you for your review, it is always great to receive positive feedback from our guests.  We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and that you found our hotel to be in close proximity to the Angel Stadium.  We are centrally located to many attractions including Disneyland and Knotts to mention some.  Thank you for visiting our hotel and we look forward to your next visit to the area.  Sincerely, Roberto Vasquez

Summary Heading: Quality Because It Used to be a Fairfield Inn
Summary: I've never been a fan of the Quality Inn chain of hotels.  Any name with the word "QUALITY" to try to describe how great it is usually falls flat as far as I'm concerned.  In fact I booked this hotel through the "Express Deals" option on Priceline.com and thought that I was going to get a Fairfield Inn (Marriot Brand) but was disappointed when I got this chain.  After the stay, I must admit that it was rather pleasant, but mainly attributed to the fact that it used to be a Fairfield Inn up until about a year ago.  Please note that if this wasn't the case, the hotel stay would have been less pleasant, and I say with experience having lived out of hotels for over 6 months back in 2012-2013 and after moving out of SoCal, I visited this part of LA County quite often.
Manager Response: Hello Ming W,  I want to thank you for giving as an extensive view of our hotel.  Yes we used to be a Fairfield Inn Marriott two years ago but we have maintained our hotel in top performance, thank you for noticing.  We do have some work to do in some areas of the hotel and I am glad that you mentioned them so we can improve.  Your review is very informative as we are always looking for ways to improve our services and we are glad that you took the time to write such details.   We hope to see you again on your next visit to the area.  Sincerely, Roberto Vasquez

Summary: I was there last march to visit Disney with my family.  we had 2 rooms.  For the cost, for the location ( 15-20 minutes driving from Disney), for the breakfast included, it's a OK hotel.  The room are not big but there's enough space if you really use it to sleep and shower between visits to Disney.  The rooms were dark, and would need some renovation soon. On a next visit i would try to find something better for the same price, and if not i would go back because it's a OK hotel.

My husband and I stayed here while in town to visit Disneyland. Check-in was easy and quick. When we walked into our room, the bathroom was noticeably dirty. The rest of the room was fine, but it looked like they forgot about the bathroom. My husband went downstairs to reception and they assigned us to a different room. This time everything was as it should be.   The room was comfortable and had everything we needed. The location was close enough, but not walking distance to Disney. You have to pay much more for that perk.   The hotel does offer free breakfast in the morning...pastries, cereal, waffles, egg, sausage and such.

We booked this hotel since it was less expensive then the hotels closer to Disney. It really wasn't very far to drive to get to Disney. When we walked into the lobby it really smelled weird, bad weird. The elevator smelled just as bad and I never did find where the stairs were. The room smelled fine, thank goodness. The room was clean and the shower was great. They have a fitness room where most of the equipment was broken and that room had a weird smell too. I also was not impressed with the breakfast setup. The area where the food was blocked access to the seating and when there were people trying to get food there wasn't any room to move around. There also was not enough seating. The breakfast wasn't available until 7 am which was a little late.
Manager Response: Hello Melissa R,  Please allow me to apologize for your recent stay at our hotel.  Thank you for letting us know that our rooms are clean and the shower was great.  We are in close proximity to Disneyland its just a short drive.  We are very sorry if our breakfast was busy and there was not enough sitting space.  Our breakfast is 7:00 AM - 10:00 AM on weekends to give our guest more sleeping time and still enjoy the breakfast until 10:00 AM.  On weekdays our breakfast is served from 6:00 AM - 9:00 AM.   Our elevator had been service with new oil and we agree the smell was overwhelming for a few hours but soon after it dissipated.   Thank you for your review and it is our hope that you give us another opportunity to serve you better.  Sincerely, Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary Heading: At least the price was good
Summary: The positive:  I arrive three hours before check in and was able to get into my room early.  Good free wifi. The bad.  For a non-smoking room, it sure didn't smell like one. If you're going to visit the Bruery, stay here.  The price is right and it's an easy walk.  Ample free parking.
Manager Response: Hello rhartogs, Thank you for your review.  We sincerely appreciate your time to let us know about your recent stay at our hotel.  I would like to apologize for allowing a room to be rented if the smell of smoke was evident.  I am very glad that our front desk staff was able to accommodate your request of an early arrival.  We do offer great wifi, complimentary breakfast and yes ample parking.  We are glad that you found our hotel conveniently and closely located to The Bruery.  Your review has been shared with our staff to make sure that we offer the best accommodations possible to our future guests.  It is our hope that you give us another opportunity to serve you better.  Sincerely, Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary: We are always looking for decent accommodations near our elderly mother's place in Placentia.  This hotel almost fits the bill...clean rooms with fridge and microwave, comfortable beds, freeway close.  But the walls are thin (we were awakened one night by next door's alarm going off at 2 am), and the first room we were offered smelled of sewage...we were quickly given another room, but it was a little alarming that the front desk clerk didn't even seem surprised at this news.  Wish we could do a little better in this area.
Manager Response: Hello azzure, We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed the accommodations at our hotel.  It gives me great satisfaction to hear from a guest that our hotel rooms are clean and comfortable.  Our goal in this hotel is to provide a clean and comfortable room to all of our guests every single time.  We are very sorry that you experienced noise from the neighbors.   If you experience any issue please let us know, our staff is trained to priorities our guests satisfaction above any issue.  Thank you again for your review and we hope that consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this Hotel after Christmas to visit Disneyland the next day. From the hotel Disneyland is about 20 mins away. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The hotel itself is a little dated, though free WiFi, parking, and breakfast are included.  The hotel is in an industrial park type area and is not walking convenient to restaurants or shops.
Manager Response: Dear Noah L, Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.   We are glad that our hotel was closed to your destination Disneyland and that you enjoyed our complimentary WiFi, parking and breakfast.  Our staff strives to provide a clean and comfortable room to every one of our guests.  Thank you for letting us know that our staff is friendly and efficient.  Our hotel focuses on delivering great customer service and I could not expect less than from my staff.   Again we thank you for your review and we hope that you choose our hotel on your next visit to the area.  Sincerely,  Roberto Vasquez

Summary Heading: Great Room, Great Value and Very Comfortable!
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 4 days and I was unsure what to expect due to the star rating but I was beyond pleased. The room was spacious, a microwave and fridge is a big plus for drinks and left overs. The restroom was very clean. The bed we had was a king and it was comfortable for the most part. Free Breakfast with a nice variety and very tasty. I highly recommend this for the value you're paying. Close to everything. We drove to Santa Monica, Laguna Beach, Newport Beach everything from 30-45 min distance.
Manager Response: Hello Daniela M, I would like to thank you of taking the time and letting us know that you enjoyed your recent stay at our hotel. Our goal is to always provide a clean and comfortable room to every single guests that checks in to our hotel.  We value your feed back and will be sharing your review with our team to build motivations for a job well done.   Thank you for letting us know that our hotel was of great value to you, we do offer complimentary parking, WIFI and breakfast.  We are proud of serving a quality breakfast that most of our guest enjoy.   Again, thank you for your review and we hope to see you soon.  Sincerely, Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean & Comfortable Place of Average Quality
Summary: I stayed here on business.  The hotel is located near Alcoa in an industrial part of town.  This place is a little out of the way, but for $79 (booked on Hotels.com) plus $7.90 in taxes, you likely won't do much better, as the OC beaches and Theme Park districts of the county make it hard to find value based hotel accommodations for business travelers.  The lobby of this location is very dated and does not make a very welcoming first impression.  They serve a free breakfast, not bad and nothing to write home about.  I recommend adding biscuits and gravy.  They also provide free and fast WiFi.  Parking is also free.  The rooms are unremarkable and tired looking.The rooms are clean and free of any gross bedspreads.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello ConstantTraveler 77, Thank you for your review, it is comforting to know that our staff is providing clean rooms to our guest.  We are glad that you found value in our hotel amenities.  We offer complimentary WIFI, parking and breakfast that most of our guests enjoy.  We are also centrally located in Southern California near many important attractions like Disneyland.  Your review is very important to us and we will be discussing your views of the lobby with upper management to consider replacing furniture in the near future. Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you soon.  Sincerely,  Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary Heading: Not what I expected from Choice Hotels.
Summary: The hotel had not been updated in quite awhile.  Small rooms, they apparently added a small chest for the new flat screen tv instead of putting it on the wall and the chest stuck out into the hallway which made it difficult to maneuver luggage, etc.  Bedding was sad and bed was unstable and shook when you got in and out.  Small thin towels, only two sets of towels for two people and did I say they were also very thin. Other than that, it was not too bad. Will not stay there again.
Manager Response: Hello Kathleen G, On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for failing to exceed your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future.  It is our hope that you give us another opportunity to serve you better in the future.  Sincerely, Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for the value
Summary: I've been choosing Quality Inn for the last few years as the hotel to stay at when visiting Disneyland.  From the hotel Disneyland is about 15-20mins away.  The hotel itself is a great deal.  I usually manage to get a room under $100/night, even on weekends.  The perks: free WiFi, parking, and although modest in choices breakfast is also included.  As for the room itself, it is clean with air conditioning and nice and quiet.  I stay in non-smoking, and the rooms feel safe as it requires a key to access the area.  The room itself has a fridge, microwave and coffee machine which coming from a Vegas local as myself is hard to come by as I'm used to see fridges where they're only meant as a means to stock items that hotels can charges visitors for.  The only con was the a/c units

I had arrived to a wonderful chocolate bar on my desk from the management saying they were thankful that I was a loyal customer . I really appreciated that. The first night I had trouble sleeping since the neighbors had a young infant who cried through out  the late hours of the night . I asked the front desk the next morning if I could move to another room. Without hesitation she accommodated me to a nice clean room. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean. Convenient location close to Orange where I was working. All the staff I met were very personable. I was giving up on Choice Hotels as I have stayed in some run down ones in Arizona, but this Quality Inn has given me hope. I would recommend this to anyone staying around the area.

Got here at 10:15 p.m. after a long flight from the East Coast. It took 20 minutes to check in even though I was first in line. The girl at the counter said she wasn't "authorized" to do some things, she was on the phone several times with a boss. She even had to run up and peek in my room. I wasn't given any explanation for this odd turn of events, I had a normal reservation.  Room is comfortable but the bathroom smelled horrible, not sure why, some gas coming up from the drain maybe?  Went to use the workout room, the AC is left off so it was quite hot for a while. There was no water, just an empty water tank and one towel left. Ignoring the fitness room shows a lack of attention to detail among the staff.  Now it is saturday night and I called to see if I could check out at

Summary Heading: Perfect business traveler place to stay on a budget
Summary: Clean, comfortable, friendly and a great location in North OC. A large mini fridge & microwave was included. Although the room was smaller, it was nicely furnished and had great wifi and a great desk for me to get my work done. I look forward to my next visit when I'm in that area again!

Stayed 3 nights for a family Disneyland Trip, so for the amount of time we actually spent in the room it was fine. Room was a decent size and clean, but we walked around with our flip flops on while in the room because the carpet appeared dirty and there was a medium sized area by the door that was sticky (yuck). The breakfast was ok, but seating area was too small for the amount of people that were down there on the Sat. Overall the stay was nice, but not sure I would stay there again.

We booked this hotel thru Tripadvisor and was very happy with our stay. Price point was perfect.  Not a 5 star hotel but was clean, and rooms were comfortable. The breakfast is a great value...food was good and a comfortable room to eat was right near the food. I think the hours are too short however. Probably OK for business travelers but when on vacation the 6 to 9AM on weekdays is tough to make.  Pool was a little small and could be a little cleaner but was refreshing during the heatwave we had during our stay. Couldn't find the advertised hot tub/sauna however.  I would recommend this place especially if traveling on a budget.

Was in a great location in terms of getting around (by car of course), especially if your interest were Disney and Knotts Berry Farm. The room were clean, modern and well looked after - meaning house keeping everyday etc and done well enough. Breakfast was perfectly adequate if sometimes crowded but not major probs as you can just take stuff back up to your room! The WiFi was great in the room. One kind of moody lady one day looking after the breakfast layout but thank fully the next we had a another smiley friendly face. The reception was great and accommodating. Best price place to stay at that moment in time and was not let down and basically pleasantly surprised. Perfect!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for taking the time and tell us about your recent stay at our hotel the Quality Inn Placentia.  I am proud of our team for delivering excellent service.  I am glad to know that you enjoyed our amenities and that our hotel was of great value to you.  Your review will serve our team as encouragement to keep delivering excellent service and going that extra mile to deliver great service and make our guests experiences unforgettable.  Again thank you for your review and we hope that you keep choosing Quality Inns for your future stays.  Sincerely, Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary: I stayed there for 3 nights and rented 4 rooms for family members while attending my Daughter's wedding on Oct. 3.  The original room I was given had an overpowering odor of spices.  It was so bad I developed a killer headache. The previous guests somehow were responsible for the odor. We were immediately given another room which was much better. Air conditioning was great. Beds were comfortable. No bed bugs as I have read about in other reviews. No complaints.  Free WIFI worked great.  Location is near Sam's Club and also not far from El Pollo Loco and In and Out Burger.  Free breakfast in included. Warning: Eat breakfast in the first hour it is open, otherwise you are going to fight the crowds. There is one employee who attends to the food resupply but she had a hard time
Manager Response: Hello Joseph G,  We are delighted to hear about your recent stay at our hotel.  We are happy to know that our team quickly resolved the problem in your room and that upon these changes you had a good experience. Sorry to hear about the breakfast and the parking inconvenience.  We are working towards resolving the breakfast issues by adding more help in the morning when the hotel is busy, please know that this is not a common problem we only run out of items for a few minutes if the hotel is completely full. We thank you for a great informative comment and know that your feedback is very important to us.  Sincerely,  Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary: After reading the great reviews about this hotel here on tripadvisor I was confident that this would be a really clean hotel, I was wrong. We stayed in 302, third floor. Upon check in the bed sheets and the blanket were washed but stained with weird translucent and blood stains. Horrible! we had to asked 3 times for bed sheets in order to get clean non stained bed sheets, I even put the main sheet in my suitcase every morning because I didn't wanted HK to take it and replace it with stained ones. The same goes with the towels. The room window treatments were also stained so did the couch. The bathroom had a lot of long black hair all over the floor and bathtub, this was right when we walked in, guess what the shower curtain was also stained. I don't know how this hotel has so
Manager Response: Hello Chris R,  On behalf of our entire staff I would like to apologize for a less than pleasant stay at our hotel.  We would like to let you know that all rooms are inspected before given to a guest and please accept my sincere apology for not delivering a clean and comfortable room.  Our everyday goal is to keep all of our guest happy and we are disappointed for failing to exceed your expectations.    It is our hope that you give us another opportunity to serve you better in the future.  Sincerely,  Roberto Vasquez General Manager

Summary Heading: Reasonable stay for our Disneyland trip
