Room was basic but clean w/ a comfortable bed, a fridge & a microwave too I think (we didn't use it). We got up early for breakfast & had fruit, yogurt, cereal, a Jimmy Dean breakfast sand & coffee. Better than Mcd's and it's free! Parking is like $6, no resort fee though - so no big deal. Overall it was a nice stay a few miles away from Disneyland. I would stay here again for $60. Thanks for reading my review - J

The rooms are very nice & clean. The staff is very friendly and showed me excellent customer service. The bed is so comfortable. The wi-fi single is very strong. There are food place close to the hotel. I would rate this Fairfield Inn one of the top hotels in the Placentia / Fullerton area. I am so very glad i decided to stay here.

This is obviously a hotel that was converted from a lower-end hotel at some point in the past.  The 1st & 2nd floors are outside-entry, but the 3rd floor has the doors on the inside.  It's kind of strange.  We weren't happy when we pulled up, but somehow (probably because I have Marriott status) we ended up on the 3rd floor, which was good.  The rooms are definitely dated, and could use an overall refurbishment.  That said, it was pretty clean, so that helped.  The location is strange - kind of by itself in some office parks.  No food within walking distance, but I doubt anyone staying here would be planning on walking anyway.  Disneyland is 15-20 minutes away, and North LA/Hollywood is about 45 minutes away.  Breakfast was ok, but not great.  The hours we were told at check-in

Stayed for 5 nights while on a local visit. Convenient to places I needed to go in Placentia and Fullerton. Somewhat difficult to walk places as it was located in a light industrial area. Although I managed to find "The Brury" close buy which ad a tasting room!! Anyway the breakfast was adequate and the staff friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable and pool area quiet. Wifi was being upgraded so had some issues, but signal was stronger every day. For the money it was worth it.

This is a strange Fairfield Inn.  The first issue is the office is not very well marked, but after locating it was easy. The elevator is slow and most rooms are with outside corridors, not something expected from a Fairfield Inn. Our room was "inside" on the top floor, but still felt weird.  The hotel staff was typical, not very nice or rude, just middle of the road. No thank yous or anything for being a Marriott Rewards Platinum member.  This hotel is quite a distance from Disney and they charge for parking which is odd because there is NOTHING of interest nearby.

Summary Heading: Not what they claimed it was
Summary: I chose this hotel out of all of the others in the area for a couple of reasons:  1) Their ad stated that they had queen size beds, not doubles. I like to spread out when I sleep and sharing a double bed with another adult is just not roomy enough for either of us.  When I checked in the desk clerk said that he had my room with 2 double beds reserved. I told him that I had been assured on the phone that I was booking a room with two QUEEN beds. He informed me that there was nothing he could do to help me because all of their other rooms were full and basically I was stuck with them. No apology or anything.   2) They claimed to serve Jimmy Dean sausage biscuits for breakfast. My son is very picky about breakfast. He loves these biscuits and I knew that it would make it cheaper

Room absolutely spotlessly clean.  Complimentary Arrowhead water.  Room located on ground floor with parking literally in front of our room.  Train runs near hotel, but we always bring a sound machine to muffle out noises, and we also turn on the fan on the a/c so we heard nothing.  We had double beds that were very comfortable.  Refrigerator and coffee maker.  Room on the smaller side.  Sink in room next to closet.  Great water pressure in shower.  Free breakfast.  Little bagels, toast, fruit salad, cereals, make your own waffles, sausage patties, egg patties.  Overall a great value.  Would definitely stay again when returning to area.  Side note: there is nothing within walking distance.  The hotel is in a business district and everything was closed on the weekend.  Friendly

My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary trip to Disneyland. Although there weren't necessarily any problems, it just wasn't up to par with all of the other fairfields we have stayed in. As soon as we walked in the room smelled like smoke. The bed was not comfortable and the sheets were awful. Breakfast was mediocre. Muffins were bad, cereal was stale. If you are just coming to stay for a night you'll be good.

Nice overnight get away! The room was small but nice and clean, and the complimentary breakfast  was very good! Located in a very quiet area, only minutes away from great restaurants and local attractions. Would definitely recommend to my friends.

Absolutely enjoyed my stay there. Was in a slightly peculiar location. But all in all was a great stay. The rooms were extremely clean. I would recommend this hotel for any travelers on route through the area.   The price was unbeatable for the service we received. Book in advance for the best price.

Summary Heading: Get a map and make this your base!
Summary: I was referred here from the Marriott at Cal State Fullerton which was sold out.  It's also a Marriott property but not same target market.  I was spending 10 days catching up with old friends and doing some business.  I was in the motel/hotel niche.  This by far was the best!  Very friendly staff, clean and nice sized rooms and quiet.  It's near all the Orange County freeways and only 10 minutes from Disneyland.  I only wished I had found it sooner because I  would have used it as my base.  I paid more money for less the entire time I was in the area.  The complimentary breakfast looked and smelled great!  I didn't partake as I had a breakfast meeting with former colleagues.  For those heading to Disneyland and other attractions I'd get a map of the freeways and use this place

This is a clean, friendly and really nice facility.  While a bit small, it does the job in a very nice way, including the pool area.  Didn't get a chance to see the Fitness Center, but for a small property, I'm impressed it has one.  Breakfast is included and it had variety.  Only drawback, and considering the location it's minor, is the lack of security for the parking area and entry way.

Summary Heading: A perfect spot when visiting Fullerton
Summary: The Fairfield Inn Placentia/Fullerton was a perfect choice on my recent visit to Cal State Fullerton.  - The room was just perfect all that I could have asked for - The staff just as friendly and helpful as could be - the property is situated out of the hub bub so that it a peaceful and quiet place - A terrific value  I highly recommend thie Fairfield Inn Placentia/Fulleton. I understand why CSU Fullerton selected it for the designation of Alumni Preferred Lodging partner . It is well deserved.

easy check in.  very friendly and helpful staff.  free wifi throughout property.  connectivity could be better.  free breakfast included.  swimming pool and fitness center on site though we didn't use it.  free parking.  easy access to 57 and 91 freeways without the noise.  center location for travelers who want centralized location for easy access to orange county,  los angeles county, and the beaches.  safe location.  adjacent to property are many corporate offices.  reasonable price.  clean room.  bathroom very clean with good plumbing.  not noisy.  no on site restaurant.

When we was looking for the picture in the website we thought that we will be accommodating in a nice hotel but unfortunately the real is not like the photos at all or not even close to them.  The hotels lobby is too small you can say it is an entrance not a lobby... 90% of the rooms are overlooking and doors opening directly to the parking lot!!!! I was wondering who is the genius architect of this design. You can say that it is an all of all GLOOMY place and the worst part of the story is to have an AC unit the room that was working even you shut the power off!!!!!!!!!!!! Never will take the chan e to go there again :-(

We stayed here when we visited Disney. It was clean and well maintained. The room was clean, and the bed was comfy. The room came with a fridg, a microwave, and coffeemaker. The continental breakfast was pretty standard. We will definitely stay here again when we come to Disney. It is pretty close to the parks, and the price was just right!

Summary Heading: In the middle of Orange County venues
Summary: My co-worker and I had to spend a week working LA & Orange County.  This hotel is almost hidden but convienient to dining, Disney, Anaheim Angels, Honda Center, and best of all-- our customer base.. My room was perfect.  Everyday the room was immaculate when I returned, and no issues. For her, there were some small issues with a shower that did not turn completely off, but I didn't have to listen to the drips..  There was a pizza advertisement in the room that if I were picky, and not the problem of the property, the pizza took over an hour to arrive.

I read the reviews before booking... So I should not have been surprised!  However when we opened the door to the hallway @ there was a large dog left to roam while owner stood by... Smh  The food was meh... The area so crowded you feel like a school of sardines ready to be canned.   The lobby area & hallways all have a horrible musty, smoky, old odor that is difficult to describe. It makes your lungs seize as soon as you breathe it.   The upside is the rooms are clean albeit old style but this is low end Marriott. Still I expect more from Marriott being a frequent Marriott guest.   Their is no spa tub in the pool area & the pool  is not heated! That definitely saves them money.   The star rating was difficult the staff were nice helpful but the hotel just really lacks.

This is a very good hotel. This was my base for 3 nights while exploring anaheim and the california beaches. From this hotel I could go to Huntington beach, to Newport beach, anaheim. This is a quiet hotel near the freway exit that puts you about 10 min from anaheim. Very good price for the quality. They have a very good breakfast with waffle machines and everything. It is a 4 star standard hotel. They waived my parking fee wich was very nice.

Summary Heading: Inaccurate Google Maps of the location
Summary: This hotel is located next door to another Marriott franchise chain a Residence Inn but in an industrial area.  The neighborhood is not a place where you would want to walk around and besides a liquor store and a Jack in the Box there is nothing to walk to (those aforementioned places included).  Google Maps oddly shows the location as several blocks away and much closer to Fullerton.  The hotel could use a renovation but the service and rooms are adequate if you are low maintenance.  Access to both the 91 and 57 highways is good and it is a short distance from downtown Fullerton.  My #1 annoyance was that neither this hotel nor its sister had an ATM machine.  I was told that the "bank" across the street had one but the CREDIT UNION machine was out of service.

Summary Heading: Adequate, great staff cant make up for older property
Summary: This was an OK property and for the right price a good value if you're only staying a night or two. I got a great price on Kayak, but I would be disappointed if I paid the $80-100.00 rates I saw posted elsewhere. This property just can’t command that kind of money. The room was  small-ish, clean, had manual A/C unit and a clean small (unheated) pool, no whirlpool.   PRO's:    •  VERY friendly staff.  Even the housekeeping and maintenance workers smiled and held doors open for you. A rarity nowadays. Front desk staff was nice and helpful finding restaurants, etc.  •  Has micro/fridge combo in room •  32” flatscreen •  Clean •  Third floor rooms are INTERIOR corridors •  Solid surface counters with tile floors in bathroom. Bathroom (small) was clean •  Good beds, very good pillows

If you just need a place to sleep for a night, then this hotel might be just enough. The locations itself is a bit distant from major theme parks and attractions. The room itself felt old. As we walked in there was a humid smell and a bit like the room had been a smoking room before. The building itself looked like a motel from the outside. Not much room inside the room. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom and shower looked dated but clean.   What I did like, was the sound proofing, we couldn't hear much from the neighbors however, footsteps from the room above woke us up in the morning, those noises you can hear.  Overall, it was disappointing to know this was a Marriott chain hotel. I would look for another hotel closer to the main attractions and for about the same price.

Summary Heading: Very friendly staff and clean rooms.
Summary: Stayed for a business trip during a weekend and was quite surprised at how friendly the staff was. Wasn't able to get a double bed room because of how busy they seemed to be. Complementary breakfast was decent and the woman running it was very quirky and pleasant compared to most staff at other hotels. Hotel internet was extremely slow unfortunately maybe because of the amount of traffic? Parking is rare latter in the evenings but otherwise the rooms were clean and comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for this kind review. I apologize about the slow Internet speeds, it must have been a temporary issue.

Summary: I work for a college prep program and we had a trip to LA to visit a couple universities around the area.  We also wanted to stay near Disneyland.  We had a reservation made at a different hotel but with only 10 days to go before the trip the hotel lost our reservation.  I called the Fairfield Inn in Placentia and Berenice basically saved our trip.  She was wonderful to deal with and was able to accommodate a group of 29 in very short notice.  She also gave us a great rate!!!!   Once we arrived at the hotel, the staff was very nice and helpful, the free breakfast saved us a lot of money and the proximity to Disneyland also saved us a lot of time.  This is the place to stay when you are visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review! Glad we were able to acommodate your group and we're happy to hear that everyone had a great time.

Summary Heading: A little under the Fairfield standard.
Summary: I have stated at a fairfield inns quite a bit when I travel because you know what to expect. This one is just is not up to par primarily because it is an older balcony hotel. Rooms were very small. Pool was always dirty.

Enjoyed the whole experience. Location was perfect situated to Disneyland and surronding attractions. Breakfast was always a nice treat in the mornings. But during the weekdays, a employee named Evelia made our breakfast feel like we were in a relatives house. She was always pleasant and had a smile. There was times when a whole lot of guests came for food but Evelia was happy to help all. And she always kept on smiling. Evelia would be a main reason for our future stay at the Fairfield Inn in Fullerton.
Manager Response: We agree, our staff alone is reason enough for staying at our hotel, and we'll be sure to recognize Evelia for a job well done. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!

Summary: This was not a good stay - an unfortunate choice for a business trip to the Anaheim Convention Center.  There was nothing going for this hotel - from a tiny room to overcrowded breakfast area with no room to sit after 7:00am, to poor business facilities, to a tiny, dirty pool. In the room, there wasn't even a workdesk, so it was definitely a poor choice for business trip. Immediately outside the room, in the hallway, there were smokers at most hours of the day, and the entire floor reeked of smoke, despite being a "non-smoking facility"!  Despite repeated complaints to front desk, nothing was done about it.  The surrounding area is an industrial zone that has absolutely nothing - no place to eat, no public transportation.  Without a car, you are stranded.  Getting from this
Manager Response: I apologize for your recent experience at our hotel. The lapse in service you experienced is certainly not in line with the great customer service our guests have come to expect. We are looking into the incidents you described and will take actions to make sure this will never happen again. Again, we are sorry that your recent stay was not in line with what you rightfully expected from our hotel, and we thank you for your feedback, it is greatly appreciated.

Summary: We were scared to see what we were getting when we paid such a low rate. We were pleasantly surprised.  It was very clean and convenient from airport. If you are in the area this deal will be tough to beat.
Manager Response: Thank you! Glad you had a pleasant stay.

Summary: This place is wonderful. They serve you breakfast and on certain nights they serve dinner. They're pool is great. The rooms are nice and comfy. They have a computer you can use downstairs for free. The water works great. Their service is wonderful and helpful
Manager Response: Thank you! Glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: My husband and I came from Chicago to Southern California for my cousin's wedding.  My cousin and his bride made accommodations for their guests at this hotel. My hubs and I were very impressed with the warm welcome we received upon check in.    Our room was small and cozy with a king sized bed.  It was conveniently located on the first floor and we were able to park our rental car right in front of our room.   Our room was clean and did not smell (we've had bad experiences of smelly rooms before!).  Each day, house keeping came and freshened up our room and gave us clean towels.    The pool area was very clean and well maintained.    Each morning the hotel offered breakfast, which consisted of cereals, English muffins, toast, make-your-own waffles, and egg and sausage
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review! I'll forward your comment to Dolores, she'll love to read your shout-out. I apologize for the noise from the AC, we will look into the issue, it certainly shouldn't be waking you up at night. Again, thank you for your feedback, and we are looking forward to seeing you again next time you're in the area!

Summary: My family of 3 stayed here for a week at the end of June. Front desk and breakfast staff were friendly and helpful. Hotel room was comfortable and clean. With free breakfast, refrigerator, microwave, easy parking and free wifi, we felt this hotel was an excellent value.

The clean, comfortable room with a refrigerator and free WiFi was perfect for our one-night stay. The breakfast at this Fairfield Inn was much better than the breakfast at a similar property in this area where we stayed a few weeks ago.   The staff at this location really shines. The women at the front desk were friendly and professional. One of them helped us to solve a problem that was not caused by the hotel. The breakfast buffet team was the best I have seen in a long time. They were moving all the time, refilling food and cleaning tables, while smiling and chatting with guests. I hope that Marriott appreciates these hard-working employees! I'm sure we'll stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience! We'll be sure to recognize the staff for a job well done, they are truly the heart of our hotel.

Summary: Was very clean, the beds were comfortable.  The staff was great.  The ladies who take care of the breakfast in the morning were wonderful!!!!!   It was quiet. Close to Disneyland!  Loved the fact that they had a refrigerator.  We bought waters and sodas at the Walmart down the street and kept them in there during our week long stay.  Great area, lots of good places to eat!  In & Out burger is really close! Would stay there again :).
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review. And yes, gotta love that In-N-Out burger... . We hope to welcome you again the next time you're in the area.

Summary: Good motel, clean & in quiet area. Beds very comfortable & fridge + coffemaker in the room. We could park right outside. There are plenty of restaurants a short drive away. Swimming pool is small but has good chairs around it. Easy to find as just off the 57. Didn't have the breakfast other than fruit juice but there was plenty of it.  Very happy with our one night stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review!

Summary: I used Hotwire and received a decent rate for the room. The room itself was clean (although the walls were a tad bit dirty). I was in a single King and it was by far the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. You could barely get around the bathroom door to access the sink. The staff up front was friendly, yet couldn't tell me where my room was. She didn't know! Really? She had to ask another staff member.  The pool are was nice, but I only stayed a few minutes because the surrounding bushes were swarming with bees and yellow jackets. Kind of ruined the relaxation having to swat stinging flying insects every few seconds.   I was very surprised to see that they charge $5 a night for parking. While $5 is not a lot of money, the thought of charging to park in their parking lot

Our overnight stay was a pleasant one.  The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was super friendly.  One of the employees, Elva, was extra helpful with the continental breakfast, as she tended to everyone and their needs.  The breakfast here was actually worth getting up early for, as they offered much more than other hotels do with their continental breakfasts.  The location is great as it is right off the freeway, and I didn't notice much noise.  Will definitely stay here again the next time we are in the area!

Made an overnight trip to Disneyland.  Only 5-10 min from Disneyland and much cheaper than the Fairfield Disneyland Resort on Harbor Blvd.  Staff friendly, bed comfortable, and AAA price very reasonable.   Close to the freeway and somewhere near train tracks, so not the most quiet nights sleep, but not horrible.  Wouldn't keep me from staying here again.
Manager Response: Yes, the Fairfield Inn Placentia is definitely an affordable alternative to the Anaheim hotels for Disneyland visitors. Thank you for the review!

Summary: This is my first stay and I'll be here for 5 days. Have already signed up for my next visit to this area. A clean room, comfortable bed, nice flat screen TV and, their "Continental Breakfast" is better than most with a large selection.
Manager Response: Thank you! We're looking forward to see you again!

Summary: I bought my room on Priceline for $45. I was thrilled because I had stayed here a long time ago. Checkout was easy and the girl was very nice. This place is still great.   The beds are firm, but comfortable enough. Linens are clean and pretty. The room was very clean and I like the design. The pool was beautiful and plenty of extra towels were available for swimmers.  The breakfast was good. I made my own waffle, which was fun. They also have fresh fruit, so that's easy for people on the go. I saw that they offered breakfast sandwiches, but they were gone by 9 am when I got there. Breakfast is open UNTIL 9 am.  We said "Do Not Disturb" because we were clean enough and didn't want people (maids) in our room. I've learned from traveling to just not have maids in your room. Then
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review!

Summary: We stayed for 3 nights (March 27, 28, 29).  It was just OK.  WiFi was horrible.  I could not get connected the entire time I was there.  Breakfast was your typical continental breakfast with muffins, donuts, bagels, etc, waffle maker and jimmy dean sandwiches in the fridge to warm in the microwave.  Staff worked really hard to keep everything stocked, but while we were there, there were a couple of very large groups and it was difficult to find a seat and move around in the breakfast area.  We had a room with a "king" bed, but my husband (6') thought it was a little shorter than our king at home.  I didn't care for the bathroom setup much.  The bathroom door had to be shut in order to use the sink and there was no fan in the bathroom, so after a shower, the room got quite
The complimentary breakfast is great really close to disneyland. our room was very clean houseekeping and front desk really friendley. i loved it. we loved our bed so confy.

This was my second stay here. I booked a package with fights through Travelocity. I booked and received a non-smoking King room on the third floor. Check-in was easy, fast and efficient. Customer service is excellent. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Grounds are clean and breakfast is stocked well. I would definatley stay here again for the quality, convenience to Disneyland for price.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review!

Summary: We stayed here from 03/16/2012 - 03/24/2012.  Good price.  Discount for staying over 7 days if you plan ahead.  I was surprised to find that the room doors all faced outside.  That was not a problem.  The room were nice.  Had a desk, good internet service (no change), a desk and large chair, and nice size frig..  The hotel was well taken care of and they were updating the carpets while we were there.  I had read reviews about the train noise.  We didn't have any problems with that.  The breakfast was good for a continental breakfast.  Waffles, bagels, English muffins, cereals, fruit, yogurts, microwave biscuits with egg and cheese, and juice and coffee.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  The web said they changed $5 for parking.  No one said anything about that and we were not
Manager Response: Thank you! And yes, guest who book directly through us receive free parking with their reservation. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary Heading: More often ahead... a few things behind. An overall solid value
Summary: I have been staying here for 6 years for the NAMM Show each January.  It has improved a lot over that time. As mentioned by others, beds are now reasonable... I would not call them "comfy' however..and the room decor is modern.  Housekeeping very attentive.  The front desk team seems responds well to inquries.  Breakfast is tended by two long-term employees who are very nice and do a great job for requests.  Broad range of b-fast items.. not eggs however.   Where I find the "behinds" though are in the common hallways, elevators and so on. I don't understand why they can't replace the third floor carpet and more thoroughly clean common areas. This needs to be done right away...  also fans in bathrooms seem to be commonly broken or not functioning... that needs to be fixed.

Like what was said below, this property provides what we've come to expect from a Fairfield Inn.  It was clean, the beds were comfy, the staff was friendly, and the breakfast was adequate.  The breakfast on the weekdays included waffles, yogurt, assorted pastries, bagels and microwaveable breakfast sandwiches.  On the weekend we got all of the above, however the breakfast sandwiches were replaced with build it yourself breakfast sandwiches in a heated tray.  The breakfast attendant kept everything very well stocked.  We paid $67 a night on a deal where we stayed 5 nights for a reduced rate.  We were also not charged the $5 parking fee that it says they have on the website.  I think at the most we were 15 minutes away from Disneyland Parking, but probably a little closer than
Manager Response: Thank you for this nice review! We hope to be able to welcome you back again soon.

Summary: Exactly as would be expected from a FFLD Inn...clean, well kept, staff was VERY helpful with assisting with destinations (how long it would take, how bad the traffic would really be, etc).  The wifi was slow, but not unusable.  As with travel447's review, I agree-fine place for a good night's sleep..except never heard the trains(we were on the back side of the building).  Breakfast fare standard, but there was always coffee available...if we were to have to come back to the Fullerton/Placentia area, I would definitely consider this location again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience - we are glad to hear that you had a pleasant stay.

Summary: Stayed here for a night and found it to be a good place to rest.  Room was large enough to have closet. Wash area separate from shower. Mini fridge/Micowave in room.  Has free WIFI, our connection was slow on this occasion. Has nice work table in room along with side chair.  The lobby has a guest computer to print tickets, browse email, etc for those without their own laptop.  Room was clean.  Industurial area setting. Occasional train comes near hotel and can hear whistle, however, not too often.  Beds were comfortable.  Complimentary breakfast is of standard fare for continental type breakfast.  If you're looking for just a good night sleep at a reasonable price, then this hotel is worth consideration.  Charges $5/night for parking.
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest, and taking the time to share your experience.

Summary Heading: the most value you can get
Summary: for 69 dollars a night + $ 5 parking it cannot b beaten . the hotel is a motel with all ur needs big rooms and free internet and business center located 15 minutes from disney and had adequate breakfast although breakfast area is small relatively , plenty of parking and very clean , dont expect much but for a room of 4 and you pay 69 dollars it is a deal

Summary Heading: Nothing really wrong with the Hotel
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights on a family vacation to Disney. It is a nice hotel, nothing really out of place. Except may be the noise of trains, which did not bother me as I slept like a log after walking the whole day at Disney :) The room and bathroom are clean, the beds nice, and it's fairly spacious too. The breakfast area is small, but the spread is decent. The drive to Disney is 15 minutes thru surface streets.   I would not mind staying here again. But, if I visit Disney, I would rather stay at a Hotel which is walking distance from the park.

I stayed here for 2 nights while interviewing for a position for Disneyland (moving out there Monday), and enjoyed my stay very much. The bed is one of the best I've ever slept in at a hotel. The breakfast was nothing to write home about, but I didn't go hungry. The location is good as well, not far from either 91 or 57, and a lot of places to eat in the area as well. Would stay here again if I needed to.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at our hotel, and congratulations on the job for Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Go elsewhere if you want to actually sleep
Summary: I'll start with the good--the front desk and housekeeping staff are great. Free breakfast was good and has mostly continental stuff and hot breakfast sandwiches. The room is a little dated and the carpet is stained, but overall it was fine because I wasn't expecting the Hyatt.   My biggest complaint and is the reason why I am only giving this hotel 2 stars is due to the fact that I couldn’t get a full night of sleep because of all the TRAINS GOING BY ALL NIGHT LONG. Very loud trains that are impossible to ignore. I am actually shocked I didn't see this in any other reviews, but feel that I must warn you about this if you plan to stay here. I’m not even sure that earplugs would help.  This hotel is a 15-20 minute drive to Disneyland on the side streets, which you will need to

Summary Heading: Ok for a overnight sleep, fitness center smells
Summary: My experience here was not bad though. There were some turnoffs for sure, checking out the fitness center is definitely not advised without covering your nose, gosh it smelled bad. If you don't use it often then the rest was not really bad. It was an average room, clean and can sleep beds. Some rooms have windows that directly face the lights outside which may bug you for a while when you sleep. Breakfast was just ok with no eggs. Bottom line, if its your stopover while you spend your complete day outside then its doable.

The hotel is fine in terms of location and amenities.  However the hotel charges for parking and doesn't tell you until you get your bill after your stay.  You never sign anything for it.  They just hand you a parking pass (without even asking you if you have a car) and then charge your credit card for all the days you stay there.  Their only defense is that their website says they charge for parking.  This is ridiculous as fees can change day to day and others on TripAdvisor have stated they had free parking.  They refused to refund the money and were incredibly rude.
Manager Response: We regret to hear about your recent experience at the Fairfield Inn Placentia. There is certainly no excuse for the unfortunate way the parking fee situation was handled; I want to apologize for that and let you know that we have taken notes so we can prevent this from ever happening again.  We do hope you will consider returning for an experience that reflects what many happy guests have come to expect of our hotel.  Sincerely,   Sandra Gilliom Fairfield Inn Anaheim Placentia/ Fullerton

Summary Heading: If you value sleep, stay away
Summary: I was booked this hotel by marriot reservations and told it's a great hotel a couple miles from disneyland.  My husband and I booked there for our honeymoon, this was a mistake.  There is a flaw in the way the curtains are installed and the black out curtains don't close.  There is also a large security light by the windows so the room is completely bright with all the lights turned off, because of the curtain issue.  We tolerated the first night because we were so tired after the wedding then driving 4 hrs after.  The next night when we tried to get moved to another room, even another marriot we were checked out at 11pm and left to find another hotel.  This is not how I wanted to spend my honeymoon.  When I brought this to the attention of Marriot after our trip they didn't

We stayed here for 5 nites for a disneyland vacation. If you don't have a car I would not recommend it here because of the distance to Disneyland. But if you do have a car, it's about a 10 to 15 minute drive. The rooms were a little smaller than I was hoping for, and the hotel itself is a little dated, but they keep it very clean, parking is abundant, the staff is very friendly, and the free breakfast does the job.   Evelia is the person in charge of the breakfast, and she is always smiling and very helpful. Miguel is the front desk supervisor, and I think the entire front desk staff is a direct reflection of him in that friendliness and willingness to go the extra mile seems to be the standard here.  The Marriott corporation should use this hotel staff as a model for training
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! I might be a little biased here, but I have to agree with you - our staff is indeed a model for friendliness and great service, and we will be sure to recognize them for a job well done.

Summary Heading: Good hotel but watch out bidding on hotwire
Summary: The hotel was a solid 2 star.  Clean rooms, free wi-fi.  Breakfast was good continental.  Hot items were microwavable breakfast sandwiches and waffles were good.  Toilets are not set right.  They flush but you have to get the hang of it.  The hotel really needs to make it more reliable so you don't have to flush 2-3 times.   Location about 15-20 minutes from Disneyland.  The problem I have is with hotwire.  They lamined this was a 3 star hotel.  I am sorry, but the beds and rooms did not have the luxury of what you would expect from a three star, especially a Marriott hotel.  This is last time I book using hotwire.  Staff was nice and rooms were great for a 2 star and a pretty goo value if you intend to stay at a 2 star.

Stayed here for two weeks while visiting LA.Close to Disney, Knotts,Angels stadium and getting to Hollywood and LA.We stayed here for 2 weeks,nice and clean very good free breakfast hot and cold.Nice shower, comfortable beds, A/C.Staff were very good and comfy beds.Nice pool,Very close to freeways 5 and 91 and the 57 could not say a bad word about this place.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review! We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay, and we hope to be able to welcome you again in the future.  Sincerely, your team from the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Placentia/ Fullerton

Summary: This hotel was very reasonably priced.  The Staff were friendly.  Free breakfast always a bonus.  We stayed here to go to a game at Angel Stadium. Close to everything.  Will stay again.  Great value.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review! We're looking forward to welcome you again soon!

Summary: Very good rates are available at this property using Marriott's "look No Further" rate guarantee.  It is Fairfield Inn so not a Full Service Marriott, but that being said is a nice place and great value.  Easy freeway access and not to far from most attractions (Disneyland, Knotts, sports venues).  Recommended for value per buck.  Even had evening "diiner" (hamburgers and hot dogs) complimentary the night I was there.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience, we are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Placentia/ Fullerton!

Summary Heading: I loved it - the service was superb
Summary: The hotel is great and service is superb.I was amazed by politeness and professionalism   of the desk attendant  Swati Munshaw and her manager and  they willingness to go extra mile  to accommodate  my family.  Great job! Thank You!         Yakov
Manager Response: Thank you, Yakov! We appreciate your recommendation, and I'll be sure to forward your comments to Swati and the rest of the staff, they will love to read them.  Greetings, your team from the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Placentia/ Fullerton

Summary Heading: Super hotel, will definitely be back!
Summary: We stayed at the Fairfield Inn during our tour of Nevada and California and it was easily the best hotel we stayed in.  We originally booked for five nights and then were going to San Diego and then back to a different area in Anaheim but the service and quality of the hotel made us decide to book the two nights back at the Fairfield.  The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful and the hotel even provides a quest barbecue and utensils to use all free of charge.  The rooms are large and bright and very clean.  We had an abundance of pillows which made a change to all the other hotels and the beds were very comfortable with soft sheets.  The room had a 32" flat screen TV, a fridge that didn't have the ice compartment iced up and a microwave.  The hotel provides a breakfast of
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and hope to be able to welcome you back again soon!

Summary Heading: I'D LIKE TO USE A LIFELINE...THE FAIRFIELD STAFF PLEASE
Summary: I was mad enough at Priceline.com I could have spit nails. I booked this hotel through them, and everything was going smoothly. Mind you, I thought with it being so far from everything, I had a mind set of things were going to be all bad. However, despite my state of perception, the hotel staff was not only able to get through it, but reversed it as well. The accommodations were proper, staff when we checked in was great, the breakfast was killer. All this was good enough to get me to want to extend our stay another night. That's where things got hairy, between William Shatner & his fur coat wearing sumo and myself. Well after arguing with their customer care people & anyone else for a good hour and a half, I finally was able to take a chance, and try to name my own price again
Manager Response: Haha, never mess with Shatner, that's a fight no-one can win. Either way, we are happy to hear that you liked our hotel and the staff, and thank you for the recommendation!  We hope you'll be back again soon!

Summary Heading: Nice place for a short stay
Summary: I stayed at the Fairfield Placentia for 2 nights. Unlike other reviewers I found it quiet and peaceful. It was a lot of hotel for the money. The staff seemed quite nice. The hallways could use some painting, but the room was just fine. Nice to have free internet service. I would stay here again.

I arrived around 1:30 p.m. on a Friday, the customer service was excellent. They found me a room that was ready, requested the 3rd floor which has access to the room from inside. Floors 1 and 2 are exterior access. Location was close to all freeways, no major eating places near though. Facilities were clean, room was smaller, comfortable bed and pillows, good shower head, smaller bathroom. Breakfast was plentiful. I would definitely stay here again for the service and accommodations.
Manager Response: Thank you for the friendly recommendation! We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: I paid 50.00 on hot wire.  One of the best deals ever. They had a huge free breakfast in the morning.
Manager Response: Thank you! We hope to be able to welcome you back again soon!  Greetings, your team from the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Placentia

Summary: Hhhmmm......chose this hotel due to the other reviews and the Marriott name. This is a noisy hotel. You can hear people outside and people talking in other rooms and kids running amock in other rooms too. The first floor rooms are a nightmare. Some face the parking lot so you hear people arriving / departing in cars, car alarms going off etc and we were disturbed by a pizza delivery man knocking at our door (mistakenly) at 11pm which was annoying and a little frightening too. The front desk staff are lovely, friendly and helpful too. The breakfast is a real "bun fight". The food is ok, however queing is a nightmare, especially at weekends. Basically, there is not enough room to seat all who want breakfast. Location is ok, about 5 miles from Disney and the immediate area around

We came here cause it was a Marriott. Front staff was Nice But it gets Very loud here at Night  there was a dunken party out by the pool With all the drinking i would not even take  my kids out swimming... we were on the second floor and there was kids above of us running around sounded like they were jumping off the beds it was bad. Front office tried to tell them to stop but it never did.I could of slept in the car and it would of been more quieter. Kids should not be placed on the third floor. Also on the second night we came in and a little afraid to get out of the car Due to kids roaming through the parking lot, This place should have Security but they don't.. I don't think i will be back..

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, close to freeway and area attractions
Summary: “Ouiet and Clean Hotel”  My sister and I were pleasantly surprised to find this hotel with great freeway access.  It is minutes away from Disneyland. Typical small but cozy rooms. Clean. Good daily breakfast with lots of variety including "make your own waffles".  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Quiet location in an industrial park. Free internet access. We will definitely stay again!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at our hotel, and for highlighting some of our hotel's best features: central location, clean rooms, friendly staff... and yummy fresh waffles in our complimentary breakfast!  We are very much looking forward to welcoming you again soon.  Sincerely, Your team from the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Placentia

Summary: Excellent. Would stay there again and recommend to family and friends
Manager Response: Thank you, we very much appreciate the recommendations!  Greetings, Your team from the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Placentia

Summary: I traveled for one entire week to Anaheim and my stay at the Fairfield Inn- Placentia hotel was one of the most comfortable ones. I travel to several other places and it is always a plus to have breakfast available in the morning especially when time is limited in the mornings.. I found the rooms clean and comfortable to rest, and a great staff always smiling at the front desk.   The location is great since it is close to freeways.. that sure makes my life easy.. I will for sure stay in this hotel again in my next visit to Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this great review! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel, and I personally couldn't agree more: a complimentary breakfast bar with a variety of food options really helps to start the day off right!  We are looking forward to welcoming you again during your next Anaheim trip!  All the best, Your team from the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Placentia

Summary: This is a nice hotel about 10 minutes from Disneyland Park.  The rooms are a little outdated but everything was clean.  The Continental breakfast was nice and there was a good variety.  There is not very good soundproofing in the rooms however.  We were on the second floor and there were children in the room above us.  It sounded like a herd of elephants running around above us (at 11 p.m. and later).  Even after a call to the front desk, the noise did not stop until they went to bed.  Same problem in the morning.  If possible, ask for a room on the top floor.  Also, if you are traveling with children, a room on the ground floor would be nice for the other guests :).  Knowing this, we kept our 6-year-old very quiet.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, we always appreciate guest feedback. I am sorry to hear about the noise problems, I have taken note of this, but I am also glad to read that you were happy with the cleanliness of the hotel and the generous complimentary breakfast buffet.  We hope to be able to welcome you and your family back again soon.  Sincerely, Your team from the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Placentia

Summary Heading: Exterior very attractive and well maintained.
Summary: Room was too small, bathroom way too small.  The room had an odd smell, bathroom had a mildew odor.   Bought some febreez and that took care of things.  Staff very attentive.

My wife and I had an opportunity to take our kids to Disneyland. We are Marriott fans, so we searched for a hotel in the Disney area. The hotels in around Disney were too expensive and the taxes are are a little pricey. I found this hotel in Placentia and decided to book there. We had a great stay and ended up saving money. They had a free breakfast and free parking. It was only a short 10 minute drive to Disneyland. I would stay here again. The staff were nice to my kids and they also seemed very accommodating.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our hotel, and for taking the time to post this review. It is always a pleasure to hear that our guests enjoyed their stay, and that our staff has once again proven to be one of the friendliest and most accommodating around!  And you are right, our hotel offers a great alternative to the often more pricey Anaheim properties, and we're only a few minutes away from everything the area has to offer (Disneyland, Convention Center, Honda Center, Angel's Stadium,...)!  We are looking forward to welcoming you again soon.  Greetings, your team from the Fairfield Inn Placentia.

Summary: We spent 3 nights durring spring break. The check in was a snap, even though it was late, the front desk clerk was wonderful. The room was a bit small, but comfortable. the oversize pillows were fantastic!  The Fridge and micro are great touches. At night the room was quite  :  )      Breakfast was ok, lots of breads and micro wave breakfast sandwiches, cereals,doughnuts etc.. fruit was apples and fruit cocktail, oh regular and activtia yogert is available,   Hotel is in a business park area, I felt very safe but nothing around you. There is a Concentra medical clinic across the street , a plus if someone has medical concerns..   I would consider staying again if the rate drops, for the size of the room, I could get a hotel across from Disney for about a 1/3rd less and double
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this great review, we always love to hear from our guests! We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and hope to welcome you again soon.  Greetings, your team from the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Placentia.

Summary: My wife and I stayed there for 5 nights. At first, I wasn't really impressed but it became an OK place sto stay for the price.  The lobby is small but comfortable with a couple of computers set up.  Our room was a little small but well maintained with the housekeeping staff.  The heater was either on or off; the thermostat apparently didn't work.  There was no such thing as adding a little warmth.  We got full heat until too hot, then I had to turn it off until we got cold again.  TheTV was a tube TV.  Drinking cups were plastic.  Fridge and microwave in room.  Free WiFi.  The pool area had a brand new gas BBQ. The building is old but decently remodeled.  Security was not as good as modern built hotels but we felt secure at all times.  The layout of the building itself was a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, your comments are very much appreciated. I am sorry to hear about the thermostat, that is definitely not in line with the service and room quality our guests have come to expect - I have taken note and will see that the issue will be fixed, if it hasn't been done already.  We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and hope to welcome you again soon.  Greetings, your team from the Fairfield Inn Anaheim/ Placentia.

Summary Heading: I will definetly be staying at this hotel again.
Summary: The hotel stay just made our family trip to California more enjoyable. We didn't have to worry about breakfast with the continental breakfast provided. There were very good food choices. The room was very clean and having a microwave and refrigerator made it very convenient with children. We will be staying again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, we always love to hear back from our guests! The breakfast bar has indeed a great selection, I personally love the fresh waffles. We're glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and we hope to welcome you back again soon.  Greetings, your team from the Fairfield Inn Anaheim/ Placentia!

Summary: The beds are comfortable, however this hotel is lacking in other areas.  The carpet in the room was dirty, the wall paper in the bathroom was peeling, the bathroom was tiny, and the doors for the rooms were on the outside so didn't feel as safe.  So decent hotel if you can find a deal, but don't expect a three star hotel.

Our room was located on the third floor, we spent 5 nights there, it was clean but very hot in there, everynight we had to open the window and use some AC to keep breathing ;) The breakfast was simply amazing, buffet breakfast included in the price, and we could chose all this: - Waffles, Donuts, Muffins, English Muffins, Bagles, Toasts (brown and white), Eggs, Quiches, Yogurts, Cereals, Milk, Fruit (mostly apples and bananas). - Butter, Philadelphia, Strwaberry jam, Apricot jam, Syrup. Simply amazing :D! We actually only spent there the sleeping time and breakfast, but at least wi-fi internet is included too ;)

Summary Heading: The good reviews are on target!
Summary: I had no complaints about this place. Clean rooms and the linens were comparable to those you find in full service hotels. Towels were fluffy. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast had lots of options, including waffles and microwaveable egg sandwiches. The location was in an office park so it was very quiet.  The pool area was clean and comfortable. Easy access to the freeway and about 10-15 mins from Disneyland.

Stayed at this hotel for two nights (July 25-27) with a couple of friends and was very pleased.  Clean rooms, comfortable beds, good water pressure, nice people at the front desk, free parking, free in-room wi-fi / internet access, free coffee in the lobby, free continental breakfast til 9:00 or 10:00AM (I forget what time it ends), free newspaper (USA Today), oh, and free access to a well-maintained outdoor pool.  The only minor criticisms: the elevator emits a somewhat unpleasant odor - like oil and rusty metal, and the bathrooms, while immaculately clean, lack draw fans. Located less than mile off the Orange Freeway (aka '57'). Would definitely stay here again.

I booked this hotel through Hotwire with US$42 per night plus tax, I was disappointed when Hotwire confirmed my booking because Hotwire rate this hotel is a 3 star hotel but after I was told the hotel name after confirmation, I found out that this hotel is usually rated 2 1/2 star only.  Overall, I stayed at this hotel from July 19 - July 27 for 8 nights.  This is not a fancy hotel but they provide complimentary hot breakfast that good enough to fill up my energy for the first couple hours in Disneyland.  This hotel is only 10 to 15 minutes driving distance from Disneyland therefore I picked this location from Hotwire.  However; if you plan to visit Universal Studio, this hotel is far away, so if you stay at this hotel for Universal Studio, you should consider to leave hotel

We stayed here from June 23-28th for five nights.  Very close to Knotts, Block at Orange and of course Disneyland.  We checked in around 2:00pm and were given a room on the 1st floor with two doubles. The room was a perfect location next to lobby/breakfast area, pool and our rental car.  This was good with our 9 year old having fun in the pool (extremely well maintained).  The breakfast was great and plentiful, the hotel staff were excellent.  The breafast lady was fast and always taking care of people's needs with a smile.  Our room was clean, had free WIFI and not to mention the comfortable beds with plenty of pillows provided.  There is a gym on location or free acess to the one down the street.  Very safe, peaceful and laidback area with some dining options (Jack/Box,

I checked in around 3:30 PM, I requested for a double beds but I was informed that it was sold out but quickly the staff offered me a rollover bed in my king bed room. I accepted it even though I felt squeezed because actually the room is small without additional bed.   Overall, this budget hotel is decent.  The PRO: The free breakfast is good, including waffle and yogurt. This hotel provides free internet access, small refrigeror, microwave and coin laundry. The location is closed to Disney.  The CON: The room is small and the carpet is not quite clean. The bathroom is small and moldy here and there.

Summary Heading: Great Base for the Price we Paid
Summary: We needed a base for a 12 night stay with easy access to both Disneyland & Cal State Uni Fullerton & the Fairfield sat almost perfectly between the two so having been pleased with stays at Fairfield Inn's before & the very good price per night ($60) we opted to stay at this hotel & we were pleased we did.  Firstly the location is adjacent to the Residence Inn located on a quiet business park off an infrequently used main road. It's perhaps 2 minutes away from the nearest freeway junction with a McDonalds, In & Out Burger, Subway, etc a minute or two away by car. There's plenty of restaurants within a 5-10 minute drive, Brea Mall is 10 minutes away & Fullerton AMC Cinema is 10 minutes away. Disneyland Resort is a very simple 15 minute drive. The area around the hotel is generally

Summary Heading: Great place for a large group
Summary: We traveled to the Anaheim area to participate in a volleyball tournament in March.  We had 12 7th and 8th grade girls and their parents.  The hotel was very accomodating to our group.  We met in the lobby every morning before traveling to the Anaheim Convention Center and had no problems.  The free continental breakfast was great and enabled all of us to meet at our own pace before we had a full day of volleyball.  The Breakfast Attendant was the best, always refilling coffee, fruit, etc.  My husband and I (as well as the Coach and his wife) used the fitness center (one treadmill, one eliptical and one bike) and had no problems, very comfortable and clean.  The rooms were satisfactory and the hotel was able to book all of us on the same floor.  The free wi-fi was a bonus as

Summary Heading: Great place to stay!  Great value!
Summary: If you are going Disney or the Honda Center/Angel Stadium this is a great place to stay. It's a clean hotel with an adorable pool area!  The rooms are small but comfortable.  I felt very safe at this place and it was an easy drive to the above mentioned places.  Would definately stay here again.  Also got a killer deal on this hotel on Hotwire. $44 a night!

If you looking for a quick place to stay which is clean and good value this is the place. Note: Placentia is next to Anaheim and this location is quite a distance from Disneyland, Honda Center, Anaheim Stadium. Hotel is located close to Highway 57.  Disneyland is about 5 miles away. Angels Stadium/Honda Center is about 4 miles south on Highway 57.   Stayed four nights during a business trip.  The hotel is in an industrial type area so there is no walking around at night or nearby restaurant within walking distance. Hotel pictures on Orbitz pretty accurate but you are in an industrial area. You will need a car.  Hotel check in was smooth and requested a room on first floor. Room are were clean. Had a Kind size bed. Desk, sitting chair, microwave oven, small fridge. Sink is

Summary Heading: Really nice place but noisy heat/ac system!
Summary: I really like this place. The staff are courteous and accommodating, the property is well maintained, room was clean, good breakfast, etc. But the noise from the heating/air conditioning was noisy and difficult to regulate. This isn't the fault of the hotel - through the wall systems are just that way. Luckily the weather was in the 60's and I could turn it off.

Upon arrival, they gave me a better rate than I had originally gotten online.  I stayed in a double Queen room and it was nice and clean. Every employee that I met including housekeeping were friendly and kind. Thanks for the great stay!

Summary Heading: pretty nice place to stay, overall
Summary: my husband and i stayed here over the weekend to attend a nearby wedding.   the hotel staff seemed generally pretty nice, with the exception of one person who was a little grumpy.  the hotel was a great value, and having a hot breakfast was also nice.  the popcorn and coffee in the evenings was a nice touch too, since we go the munchies.  the breakfast lady taking care of the buffet supplies was really cheerful and pleasant.     the rooms are pretty clean, though could be bigger.  what we did like was having a fridge and microwave in the room, which was pretty convenient.  the free internet access was also a plus.  one thing to note: the walls are thin though, so you may hear some of your neighbors.     we booked our package through hotwire and got a pretty good deal for two

Summary Heading: Convient location, Free Breakfast, Nice Rooms, Low Price
Summary: Stayed here during a trip to Disneyland. I have stayed at other places before (including the Crowne Plaza) while visiting Disneyland, and the Fairfield Inn Anaheim was by far my favorite. It was very easy to get to Disneyland (no shuttle, so you need a car) includes an excellent breakfast, and clean room. I also like having a mini-fridge for storing drinks/snacks, so this was a very nice thing to have. There is plenty of free parking.  Its kind off off the beaten path - but it gets you away from the crowds, which when your spending most of time in DIsneyland is a very nice thing. I will defiitley stay here again on future trips to Anaheim.

Yes, the motel might be a little "off of the beaten path".   But that is not an inconvenience, especially if you have a car.    We found the motel to be clean, quiet, and convenient to Disneyland.  No problems whatsoever, and a good value for the money.  We had a great stay.

Stayed one night for an overnight trip to Disneyland. We wanted a reasonably nice place to sleep, close driving distance that wasn't going to cost a lot of money. This hotel was perfect  - couldn't beat it for the value through Priceline. No frills - but plenty of free parking, good beds, clean linens and the added microwave and fridge were nice. Smallish tv and it's in the middle of a business park area - but didn't matter to us. Only 10 minutes driving surface streets to the Disney parking structure. The customer service was amazing (they called to check on our room about 20 minutes after checking in and asked if we'd like a wake up call. I didn't expect that at this level of hotel.) The continental breakfast is far and away better than the cheap coffee and donut kind of

We just checked out of Fairfield Placentia after a 6 night stay on Saturday.  Overall the motel is clean and is quiet.  The beds are very comfortable.  The carpet on the floors is a little dirty and stained but we were pleased with our room.  It had a fridge and microwave which was convenient.  They also offer a full breakfast buffet which we utilized daily.  It is very close to Disneyland which was the purpose of our trip.  The front desk was friendly and they offer a computer with the use of a printer for free in the lobby which is handy for printing of directions and airline passes.  We would stay here again as it served its purpose but there really are not amenities other than the pool which did not have a hot tub and it was too cold to swim so nooone used it.  If I ever go

For a Marriott property - I would expect more.  My son and I arrived at 4pm on a Saturday and checked in.  The smell of old nasty smoke greeted us as we entered the front door.  I am guessing this used to a be a smoking hotel - turned nonsmoking.  The front desk personnel were ok - they did not seem to enjoy their job or maybe the 3 that were there that day - were having a bad day.  They had to copy my credit card because they were having issues with their computer. On the first night from 10p - 1030p - my son and I tried to go to sleep but because the walls were paper thin - we couldnt - I called the front desk and she was able to hear our neighbors by me just putting the phone up to the wall for her to hear.  The security guard came up and asked them to be quiet and they

I stayed at the Fairfield Inn Placentia with my wife for 2 nights during a trip to Disneyland (vacations). I booked a non-smoking king room. I choosed this hotel due to the rate and due to the location (10 minutes away from Disneyland).  I found the room appearance to be not as I expected for a Marriot chain hotel. The carpet was old, had stain marks, and was not completely attached at the corners. Even though the room was clean, it seemed not to be clean. Bed was too soft, that may be comfortable for some people, but it was not for me. Bathroom with no ventilation working. Room had a new fridge and microwave oven. There was space for 1 piece of lugagge. The other 2 had to be placed on the table and on a chair.   Internet was wirelless and free. But connection was poor and not
The room in its self was okay but there were NO grab bars by the toliet and the access to shower for a person missing a leg makes it virtually impossible to enter the shower easily.

Summary Heading: Great Remodel-but location might be an issue
Summary: Very friendly check in by nice folks, Room was spotless and everything was in fine shape. Pool area is really nice. The whole property is in very good shape, I just want folks who might consider staying here with the idea of visiting The Mouse or Knotts that the hotel is located in a business park quite a distance from these locations-and the immediate surroundings are less than lovely.If you stay there with that in consideration it is a very nice place for the money.

Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Hotel is in a business/industrial area located on a dead end street-next door is a Marriott Residence Inn. You definetly need a car if you stay at this hotel - all food/restaurant and shops are further off, but the front desk staff handed us an info sheet at check in.   The room was adequate, though not really big and had a microwave & fridge. The first night was a bit loud as we heard train whistles and in the morning we heard some (garbage) collection trucks, but the second night was quiet.   Continental breakfast (toast, bagels, donuts, oatmeal, waffles etc.) was included in the rate and it also included a 'Jimmy Dean Sandwich' which was nice and different. The lobby had a computer with free internet which was nice.  The pool was nice &
Room is clean, bed was big and soft! Room has fridge and micro, also very spacious. Breakfast was good and lots of choices. The best part was the price... this place is a truly good value!

Summary Heading: good place for a good price
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two night while we visited Disneyland.  It was a great price and a great location for us.  When we arrived it seemed to more in a more industrial area (lots of businesses).  It is close to a lot of restaurants and it was maybe a 10 minutes drive to Disneyland.  It was great because it wasn't in a super busy part of town.  Check in was quick and the two men at the front desk were very friendly and gave us a lot of great information.  The rooms were wonderful.  They were very clean and comfortable.  The continental breakfast in the morning was great.  Bagels, donuts, yogurt, fruit, breakfast muffins, waffles, muffins, juice and milk.   We used the exercise facility while we were there and it was nice.  There is only one treadmill, one elipitical and one

I recently was in this area for business and stayed at this Fairfield Inn.    This hotel was set in a small business park just off a couple main freeways and roads.  It was very convient and easy to find or get on the right road to get you somewhere else in the LA/Orange County area.  The hotel is about 10 minutes of city driving from Disney and other Orange County attractions.  One night we had dinner on the ocean/beach and it took about 35-40 minutes with traffic to reach the shore.  If staying in this hotel, you would need a car to get around to attractions or restaurants or shopping.  The hotel itself was fairly standard to any other Fairfield Inn with the exception is the room included a fridge and microwave which was a nice per.  My room and the hotel in general was clean

Summary Heading: Still the best value for the area.
Summary: This was my 4th stay here and it is still a great value. They have remodeled nicely and have expanded their breakfast offerings. The industrial park location is extremely quiet on weekends. Nice central location for SoCal attractions.

Summary Heading: Decent, but a little more like Best Western than Marriott
Summary: The hotel is in a quiet area of Placentia, quiet in that there is really nothing else in the area if you're looking for food, shopping, etc. It's not a long drive away but don't expect to be able to walk around and see the city if you're staying here.  The rooms are nice and clean, although small. The entire hotel has exterior corridors, The walkways in the hotel are extremely narrow so if you're using a luggage cart, be sure you're checking in/out at a time when other guests or housekeepers wouldn't be around, otherwise it'll be hard to get the cart to your room.  I've mostly stayed at Courtyards or flagship Marriotts so this was my first time at a Fairfield property. I don't personally have a problem with Best Westerns, but that was what this hotel reminded me of. It did not
Small but well equipped.  It offers good value, nice breakfast, safe location, and satisfactory comfort.

I booked a one night stay at the Fairfield Inn - Placentia, CA for a romantic rendezvnous.  I was looking for an affordable yet comfortable room and this hotel definitely had it.  They had an AAA discount so I got the room for $80, not including taxes when it normally goes for $99.  After scouring Trip Advisor, I saw that this place had great reviews for the price so I booked it on the Mariott website directly.  I had a few questions before my stay and whenever I called, the staff was pleasant and helpful.  I also asked for an early check-in and they were able to accomodate my request as well, which I didn't really expect.  The room itself was clean and very comfortable and we had a blast.  I think the only small drawback of this place is that it's by the train tracks so

We had to book here at the last minute with 24-hour advance notice.  I booked via Expedia for $80 per night for a double-double.  The whole hotel is non-smoking.  The location is convenient to Disneyland if you have a car.  It is about 10 minutes away.  The room was clean and they called to see if we needed anything after we checked in.  They had a full breakfast (cereal, milk, juice, hot breakfast sandwiches, make your own waffles, bagels, donuts, etc.).  I was very pleased with the breakfast.  We did not get in early enough to attend the happy hour.  This hotel was much newer and nicer than the Clarion Hotel near Disneyland.  We would stay here again if we had the car and free parking in the Disneyland Parking structure.  If you don't have a car and want to go to Disneyland

We spent 5 nights at this hotel. It is located in a light industrial area--so no traffic noise or congestion and lots of trees. Yet, it was very convenient to major thoroughfares and freeways. The room (king) was comfortable and clean. There was a small refrigerator, microwave and coffeemaker in the room plus an ironing board and iron and hair dryer. There was also an exercise room that I used almost every evening. There was a computer available for guest use in the lobby--very convenient for checking my e-mail every day. I didn't take my lap top on this trip, but I understand that Wi-fi is available in the rooms and there is also a hot spot in the lobby. The pool was great and the service staff  were very friendly and accommodating.  A complimentary USA Today newspaper was

I came on a buisness trip and because of this I wasnt given the choice of hotels as my company is under contract with this hotel. This worried me a little as I am quite picky but upon arrival all my worries were alliviated. Although its no Ritz, the accomadations were more than adequate and the service was superb.... The whole staff from the front desk to the housekeepers always went above and beyond their duty and always had a smile on their face. The sales manager even came out to personally great me upon arrival and to make sure everything was to my liking. He was quite accomodating and so was everyone else... In fact I am so impressed that I am planning to return to this hotel later in the summer when I take my son out to disneyland.

Summary Heading: Convenient location, good breakfast, and friendly staff
Summary: We booked this hotel stay with AAA discount at $75.60/night. Odd amount but it was the best rate in the Orange County area.    The hotel was convenient to get to. It was off of 57 FWY, Orangethorpe exit.   The staff were friendly. We checked in at about 6pm and although we checked in fine, we overheard that many of the rooms were showing up as not yet cleaned in the system. Front desk were trying to confirm.  We were initially given Room #120 which was right next to the break room/housekeeping's office and we immediately noticed the high amount of traffic. In addition, we took a peek into the room and it was a very small cramped room. We asked for on the 3rd floor and it was larger. I think the small little walkway right at the entrance of the hotel room makes a big difference

We stayed here with kids to visit Disneyland.  It was a bit far- took us about 20 minutes to get to the park from this hotel, we stayed off the freeways.  That would be my only complaint, the distance from Disney.  The room was very clean, nicely decorated, comfortable bed with plenty of pillows, nice staff, great breakfast.  We didn't use the pool, so I can't comment on that.  If you are looking for a bargain and don't mind the drive this is the place to stay.

pleasant surprise to find this hotel with great freeway access.  Hint: close to Disney.  Typical small but cozy rooms.  Clean.  Good daily breakfast with lots of variety including "make your own waffles". Windows that open.  Quiet location in an industrial park. Spent 3 nights.  Business travelers during the week.  Famalies on the weekend.  Free computer to check your mail.

Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland.  It only took us 10 minutes to drive there durning rush hour (on side streets.)  It's in the middle of an industrial area, but that means it's very quite after business hours.  The freeway is near by, but we could not hear it.  Up to date furnishings, fridge, microwave, lovely beddings.  The room is small for two people, but we didn't spend much time in it anyway.  Free wireless high speed internet (more like medium speed.)  There is a computer in the lobby you can use if you don't bring your own.  The pool is well kept and actually kind of nice.  Workout room is simple - treadmill, bike and elipitical - but all the machines are new.  Breakfast is great (for a continental breakfast.)  It includes hot items like waffles and

We like to stay at Fairfield Inn wherever we go. This one ranked very highly and the best thing was the breakfast they offer. An amazing value for what we pay, they offer fresh hot waffles, a tasty egg, bacon and cheese biscuit and a lot more other good stuff.  The staff at this hotel always greets you and are amazing. After staying at other hotels on our west coast trip we have to say this was the best. One of the staff told us that they were newly renovated. The rooms are extremely clean and have all the amenities you really need. The location is very quiet and just what we need for a great night sleep.

To our surprise this was as very clean and nice Fairfield Inn located near Cal St. fullerton in Placentia California. Not in a particularly touristy area. Only 10 minutes from Disney parks and downtown Disney. The room appeared to be brand new. Not sure how old the hotel is but our third floor room was very clean. As far as quiet goes, we like to stay on the top floor because of too many sleepless night listening to others walk around above us. We could tell the floor would echo so those below us were listening to some footsteps. So, try to stay on top floor. Pool was clean and heated but not well heated. Breakfast was good with the staples of cereal, donuts, toast, fruit, juice, coffee etc. We would stay again for a night at a time. Prefer a suite type hotel for long term

Summary Heading: Would stay again, however, only adequate nothing more
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for one night before a cruise. Mainly choose this place for its location (5 miles form the Angel Stadium) and price ($69). The rooms are small and there is nothing special about them. Our shower had some mold on the walls but nothing too outrageous. One thing to note, the doors for all the cheap rooms (floors 1 &2) open to the outside so if that bugs you then don’t stay here. It appeared as if the suites did have indoor doors but I don’t know that for sure. The lobby is small so the breakfast was crowded but it’s such a small hotel you really can just go back to your room to eat. The breakfast was fine a continental with most bread choices. The staff was friendly and helpful which was unexpected for the price. Overall I would stay here again mostly for

We reserved our room over the phone 1.5 weeks before our stay and when we get here and pay cash for our room, we realize that it is NOT the king bed room we were guaranteed but yet a 2 double bed room! this is a problem because my fiance is fairly tall and his feet were dangling off the bed but that isnt a problem with a king bed at all. I mean the rooms are pretty okay, not the best considering we stayed at a Days Inn the night before we came here and we had a spa room suite with a jacuzzi in it and loved it! I would not want anyone to go here because they lie about their reservations..

My family and I stayed at this hotel from April 8 - 10.  We have 2 young children and if you are thinking about going to Disneyland I would not recommend staying here.  We found it a hassle finding parking at Disneyland (BTW if you are going to park there bring cash, no credit cards or ATM) and walking across this huge parking lot to an elevator  (we had 2 strollers) that didn't work at the time and then struggling down the escalator to board a tram that accomodated strollers in a couple of cars if you didn't want to fold it.  This means a longer wait to board onto the tram because of all the families with strollers.  Anyways, back to the hotel.  Our room was gross Room 221.  It stunk of smoke.  We arrived at midnight and was too tired to request a change.   There's nothing

We are Disneyland AP holders and stayed here from February 23-25, 2005 during a short trip.  We have two children, ages 4 & 6.  We used Priceline when booking the hotel for this trip and ended up getting $38 per night (w/o taxes) in room 303.  The hotel is in Placentia, just a 10-12 minute trip up the 57 Freeway from the Disney parking garage.  The hotel was clean and is surrounded by office buildings and some light industrial.    The room was average size with two queens.  The seperate bathroom had the sink, toilet and shower/tub together.  No microwave or refrigerator here, but there was free wireless internet access available in the room.  The continental breakfast was quite good.  It included toast, bagels, donuts, cold cereal, self-serve waffle maker, fruit, milk, juices

Summary Heading: extremely affordable for good service and quality
Summary: We stayed her for 4 nights in February 2004 and was thrilled about the service of the staff - the quality of the rooms and the price we paid.  we had a rental car so there was no point for us living in the city center of LA - so we chose to stay here - for $59 per room/night including breakfast.   We are going back to LA in May 2005 - and then we are definitively going to stay at this hotel once again - this time also only $59 including breakfast - its a bargain.
